I am giving two stars because I was able to pay online, despite their GENEROUS offer to send checks through the mail.  If your HOA is considering this group I would urge you to do everything in your power to prevent that.

review_text:

We notify homeowners about their HOA dues and past due balances as directed by the HOA Board of Directors. Past due statements, emails, phone calls, these would all need to be approved by the HOA Board before being pursued or distributed. Many Board Members prefer (and many HOA Governing Documents require) statements such as these to be sent via USPS.

This is the worst company I’ve ever dealt with.  I call 3 times today, first time left message . Called second, spoke to someone to try to resolve a problem with my hoa check, which they claimed they never received, and she wouldn’t check if they received it, all she said was if the hoa wasn’t paid by the 15th I was going to be charged a late fee.  Called the bank to put stop payment and called them back to tell them if they received it not to post it, because I was going to pay online, waited on hold for over 20 minutes and was connected to an answering service.   It’s very hard to speak to someone in this company .They don’t deserve one star.

I sent that check through my bill pay to be there on the 29th of the month, and you mean to tell me nobody in that office could check if it was there, because the mail had been late due to the holidays and COVID.   By the way I never missed a payment.
owner_answer:
We hate to see that you have not had a positive experience, Lee. We would like to thank you for your efforts to pay your HOA dues in a timely manner! Our agent is most likely correct here. HOA dues are considered late if not received by the 1st.

Many Boards allow for a grace period to accommodate mail and payment processing time. Anywhere from 5 - 30 days grace period is normal. In your community, if your grace period is 15 days, yes, if your payment is received on the 16th day, your account is subject to late fees (because, ultimately, the payment should have been received on or before the 1st).

Late fee removal is subject to Board approval and normally requires extenuating circumstances (i.e. being in the hospital, losing your job, death of a loved one, etc).

In order to assist you further, we will need the name of your association and your property address.  We do have agents ready and available to assist via live chat. Simply visit www.mycmg.com and click on the "Chat With Us" button to chat with one of our Community Support Agents.

review_text: They don't enforce or communicate anything except when your monthly dues need to be paid. Most of the HOA dues just go in their pockets
owner_answer:
We hate to see that you have not had a positive experience, Julie. Many homeowners are concerned about violation enforcement in the community that they are rightly concerned and/or upset about. However, there is only so much an HOA can do to enforce its rules.

1. Warning Letters – Many HOAs choose to send Warning Violation Letters to homeowners once a violation has been identified. Many times, this helpful reminder is all that’s necessary for the violating homeowner to correct the issue.
2. Fines – After letters have been sent, HOAs have the right to fine their homeowners because of violations. Fines can vary from $15/month to $100/day depending on the violation and community.

Even with both of these enforcement methods, sometimes, it is not enough to convince the violator to correct the situation.

If you'd like to report specific violations, please visit: www.mycmg.com/vio

Alternatively, please give us a call at (877) 252-3327 or email us at help@mycmg.com

review_text: Cedar Management has just taken over the management of our HOA. It has been a rough start as there have been numerous communications mailed / emailed out related to paying the first quarterly HOA fee. I received both mail and email directions. I mailed in all the paperwork to set up an ACH draft. Then, I received an invoice in the mail with directions on how to make a online payment. From my perspective, this meant that I needed to pay the HOA fee and that the ACH was not set up. So, I paid the fee online. Then, I noticed in my bank account that Cedar Management was processing an automatic payment for the same amount after my online payment. I called Cedar Management and alerted them to the issue. I spoke to Customer Service three times. I spoke to accounting staff two times. I told them that they needed to stop processing the second payment. They told me they would have to confirm with Bank of America. I sent them a screen shot of my bank account. They ignored my request to stop the second payment. Needless to say, the next day, Bank of America had indeed drafted my bank account twice for the same payment because Cedar Management did not listen to me when I alerted them to the problem. I called to speak to the Accounting Manage, Greg. He said that the only option I have now is to receive a check for the amount they drafted twice. I expressed my great frustration with their service because they made the choice to not listen to me. Which, in the end, has cost me $222.00 for two weeks. Greg said that he was not aware of the problem. Which means that when the accounting staff told me they would bring it to the attention of the manager, they did not. So, in the end, I lost the use of $222.00 and had to spend more than 45 minutes of my free time cleaning up their mistake. Very frustrating.
owner_answer:
We hate that you have not had a positive experience, Karen. Unfortunately, after your ACH was initiated with your bank and "processing", there was nothing we could have done to stop it. Your bank was already in the process of sending us your dues payment.

Your refund check is in the mail. If there is anything further we can do, please don't hesitate to reach out to us.  We do have agents ready and available to assist via live chat. Simply visit www.mycmg.com and click on the "Chat With Us" button to chat with one of our Community Support Agents.

Regarding "enforcement", we assume you're speaking about the violations in your community. Many homeowners call and email about violations in their community that they are rightly concerned and/or upset about. However, there is only so much an HOA can do to enforce its rules.

Here are the two main ways an HOA can use to enforce its rules.
1. Warning Letters – Many HOAs choose to send Warning Violation Letters to homeowners once a violation has been identified. Many times, this helpful reminder is all that’s necessary for the violating homeowner to correct the issue.
2. Fines – After letters have been sent, HOAs have the right to fine their homeowners because of violations. Fines can vary from $15/month to $100/day depending on the violation and community.

review_text: Terrible,  their system is always down and then they charge you for late payment, you cannot negotiate with them as most HOAs only serve to collect your money.
owner_answer:
We hate to see that you have not had a positive experience, Maria. Our system has not been down, so we are not sure what system you might be referring to. HOA dues payments received after the community grace period are subject to late fees. Late fee removal is subject to Board approval. We do not have the authority to remove late fees.

An HOA absolutely must collet money so that it can fulfill its responsibilities but this is not the only way they serve. The HOA typically oversees the following areas:

Maintaining Common Areas: An HOA is responsible for common areas such as green spaces, amenities, or community buildings. They should repair any damages, replace or upgrade systems, and ensure proper aesthetics and safety.

Investigating Complaints: An HOA is also responsible for investigating any complaints made by members. This could include issues with property not being properly maintained, plumbing being backed up, sidewalks being cracked, or water leaking into their home. The Association must determine whether these issues originate from something that is under their jurisdiction or the homeowner’s.

Enforcing Rules: An HOA must also enforce established rules to protect property value and the integrity of the community.

It would be our pleasure to assist you if you have any further questions or concerns. We will need the name of your association and your property address. review_text:
As a tenant of a property managed by CMG, I can say they don't seem to care about the complex or it's residents.  They do not have an onsite employee and simply attempt to manage from a distance.

They pick and choose seemingly at random when and where they want to enforce the rules.  They are violation happy and might just be out to make an extra buck.

Living under their rule has been a total crapshoot that has impeded our right to peaceful enjoyment of the property,
owner_answer:
Chris, we hate to see that you're upset about your HOA and having the rules enforced in the community. As the manager for your community, it is our job to assist the HOA board in the enforcement of your association's covenants. We also want to take a moment respond to your concerns and hope that we can help clear things up.

In reference to your association not having an onsite manager, the HOA must be able to budget for this. Assuming the HOA does have a budget, the Board of Directors would ultimately make the decision on whether or not an onsite manager is the best use of the association's funds. The use of an onsite manager is not one that we make for the association. These decisions are made by the volunteer HOA board members that live in your community.

In regards to the rule enforcement, we coordinate with every HOA board on rules that are enforced. Our goal is to enforce the covenants fairly and consistently. Sometimes infractions are missed when one of our agents performs an inspection. Sometimes an infraction may occur without our knowledge. We do not "pick and choose" rules to enforce and we do not randomly single out individuals. If you see infractions in the community that need to be addressed, please report them to us so that we can coordinate with your HOA board and follow-up with appropriate actions.

You can go to our website at https://www.mycmg.com/homeowner-central to submit a violation. You can select the form from the drop-down list on the page and attach the photos. All violations reported to us are kept confidential and only shared with your HOA board for verification.

Also, violations do not make money for the HOA and they are not a profit center for our company. HOAs may pay a small fee for the printing and postage of each violation letter sent to an owner. The goals for issuing violation letters is to enforce the community's governing documents and rules. Our goal is to provide consistent enforcement to ensure fairness for all homeowners and to help maintain the association’s property values.

If you have questions or concerns, please give us a call at (877) 252-3327 or email us at help@mycmg.com and we’ll be happy to assist you.

owner_answer:

I contacted the HOA about needing the area outside of my door touched up. I understand the weather affected the speed of service and when it was finally completed it was subpar. The individual contracted left paint all over my doorbell, doormat, and storm door frame in addition to the poor quality of the service performed. No one has returned my calls or emails regarding my concerns.

1 Star.
At this time, I would not recommend.

We came to them with a list of issues, one of which is endangering the residents of one of our buildings, and have been promised bids and haven't even received one. In five months. Our first property manager hardly ever responded to us. Her boss assigned us a new one who she promised would get in touch right away. She hasn't. We've also experienced many of the same billing frustrations and mistakes that others have reported. I've never written a google review before but this situation is so frustrating and unacceptable that everyone on the board is doing everything they can to get any attention at all. I've noticed that most of Cedar's reviews have been either 1 or 5 stars. What neighborhoods are getting 5-star service? Are they large ones (that bring more $$ to Cedar)? Are they fake reviews? I'd love to understand this discrepancy.
owner_answer:
Rachel-
We're sorry to hear about your frustrations. We are aware of deck problems and wood rot from the years of neglect prior to us starting with your association in December. We have been working to get bids and already have vendors that we are communicating with. We are also dealing with the fact that your association was underfunded and had very limited funds (less than $10k) when we transitioned from your old company. The reason it feels like we were doing the bare minimum is because there was the bare minimum to work with.

These are major issues and we are aware of the implications but this will take time (and money) to resolve. We are frustrated with these issues just as you are. However, a negative review on Google is not going to speed up the process or make things magically get better.

We have passed your comments along to your community manager and their supervisor and someone will be reaching out to you to discuss your concerns.

review_text: As long as I have been dealing with Virginia McCall at Cedar Management, she has taken care of any problems I have brought to her. She is easily reached and is very knowledgeable about and efficient getting things done. She is a great Manager to have taking care of Lake Point East HO.
owner_answer: Thank you Brian! We appreciate your feedback and will let Virginia and our team know. Please let us know if we can ever be of assistance.

review_text: The worst service in working with your community HOA account. After weeks of calling and leaving messages they nor a supervisor has the decency to return your call. Hopefully, our community will be able to get out of them managing our HOA soon! They seem to be in it for an easy buck not you and your community. Look elsewhere for a management company.
owner_answer:
Thank you for leaving a review, Tina. We hate to see that you've had a negative experience! We are set up a bit differently than most HOA Management Companies where we have a support department that can assist homeowners with 95% of their questions and concerns (balance information, submitting maintenance requests, violation questions, etc). This leaves Community Managers available to really assist the Board Members in a more focused way: creating exceptional solutions, navigating community problems, reviewing contracts, ensuring finances are appropriately managed, etc.

We do show that your Community Manager has spoken to you a few times, and most recently today, to ensure that you have all of the information we're able to provide. Our mission is to continually improve our process and raise the bar in HOA Management to a level unprecedented in the industry. Please don't hesitate to email help@mycmg.com if you have any further questions or concerns.

review_text:
I write this as a 10+ year Cedar Management community resident, 5-year HOA board member and 1 year HOA President.  Here are my thoughts.

1) To start, it appears that the majority of the reviews on this page are fake.  I get it, businesses are pressured to make sure they have good Google reviews.  But you know how you get a great Google reviews? Be a great company.  Serve the customer with excellence.

2) On the whole, Cedar Management leaves much to be desired.  On the positive side, they do just enough for a community in terms of processing dues and handling of individual account issues.  While you cannot often get ahold of them by phone, they are more responsive by email or web chat.

3) Beyond that, Cedar Management offers little value or competitive advantage.  The problems begin at the top.  In the past five years, we have been through four community managers.  Property manager inexperience combined with too many assigned properties has to significant turnover.  Cedar Management needs to stop invest in their business by investing in attracting and retaining staff.  Penny pinching in this area has led to poor customer service.

Property managers have not even done enough to get by.  Our HOA has gone through multiple months of neglect.

4) Cedar has been slow to adapt to technology and what technologies it does offer is difficult for the HOA or the end user to take advantage of.

5) Cedar Management has subpar connections to vendors.  You would think that a firm with as many properties as they have would have a better vendor network.

In sum, your community should join ours in looking elsewhere.
owner_answer:
Thank  you for taking the time to give us your detailed feedback. We're so sorry that you feel this way! Our goal is the total satisfaction of our communities, and to provide a positive and professional experience. As such, we respond to all requests and emails as quickly as possible.
1) Fraudulent Gmail account reviews are against Google's terms and business's will get penalized for such practices. We routinely survey our clients, vendors, homeowners, and Board Members to solicit their feedback.
2) We appreciate this point! It is definitely faster to communicate via email and web chat. We encourage homeowners to use these instead of calling when possible as it's a very effective way to communicate.
3) We understand that it's frustrating when you have a manager reassigned to your association. Unfortunately, we cannot comment directly on every single one, but this often happens for various reasons including managers being promoted or having to be moved to other associations or termination of employment.
4) Our mission is to constantly update our technology to stay on the cutting edge so that the communities we serve always get the latest and best service possible.
5) We have an excellent vendor network. If your community is struggling with a particular project or vendor, please let your Community Manager know.

In sum, we will have your Community Manager reach out to your Board of Directors in order to assist you and your community better. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us if you have any further questions or concerns!

review_text:
No one ever picks up a phone here.
They need to put lights up in the front entrance of my development.
The pool has been in disarray all summer and showers didn't work all summer.  The passes didn't work for awhile and anyone could have accessed the pool area.
They even pass out violation to hard working people who's shutter came off in the wind and are waiting for a replacement shutter to arrive. I called the CMG and the Hoa I also have corresponding emails. Never was a violations notice sent out twice.
Please don't reply to me to me with your lame excuses. Just try picking up a phone.
What a shameful place.
owner_answer:
Hi Susan-
We are sorry to hear about your experience.

In regards to the shutter, this was a 2nd notice for the violation. If you have questions or concerns about the letter you received, please send an email to help@mycmg.com with your association name and property address and we'll happy to review this with you and your HOA board.

We are aware of the maintenance issues in your community and your property manager is working with your board on these issues. The board of directors are volunteers that live in your community. They are ultimately responsible for all repairs and improvements that are made in the community, including street lights, pool repairs, etc. Any expenditure that goes towards these items must be approved by your HOA Board before any work can be completed.

review_text: I wanted to share my experience with Cedar as a homeowner and now as a member of my community Board of Directors.  We have worked with Cedar for almost 5 years.  Our previous company was not as engaging and honestly did not help our community.  Cedar has been proactive in helping our community control cost and improve curb appeal.  I decided to run for a position on our Board of Directors 2 years ago and have been serving since that time.  Our Community manager is very engaging and responsive and has been helpful in working with us to improve the amenities of the community.  I appreciate the Board of Director training that I have been able to participate in, I have been able to make 3 sessions since my time on the Board.  I also appreciate the detailed reporting and communication history Cedar provides us.  Overall I am very pleased with the company and those that work with our association.  As a owner and now Board member, I can with pleasure recommend Cedar to those who might be considering a new management company.  They are a top notch organization with highly qualified employees who do a fantastic job.  Thank you to Linda, Tracey, Scott and Julie at Cedar for helping our community each day.  We are a mixed community with almost 500 homes, both Condo, Single Family and Townhomes.

review_text: Very happy with our experience with Cedar Management Group.  I am on the Board of Directors of a community and have enjoyed working with Cedar and the staff.  The association management industry is very difficult and requires knowledge of the rules and regulations for each community.  Many homeowners don't understand these rules or don't care to take the time to invest in understanding them.  This leads to issues that our Board or Cedar can't control.  Reading over the recent reviews posted here,  I can tell that many of these are homeowners who don't understand the industry or what an associations purpose is.  My experience with Cedar is they have been very proactive, working to help us achieve our goals and continue our community operations in a positive direction.  Our budget has improved each of the past three years as we have worked with Cedar to review budget line items and find ways to cut cost while not reducing service to our community.  We have been able to hold back on some increases in our dues and are working to try and limit those in the future.  We have stopped reacting to maintenance issues  and have started being proactive in our approach to these.  We have worked to address rentals homes and other violations.  I was not on the Board when Cedar was selected but I can say they have been extremely helpful and professional to work with and the staff have worked very hard to assist our owners when they have concerns.  I highly recommend them not only here but to those that I interact with in my day to day business.
owner_answer: Kyle, Thank you for the extensive review.  We appreciate your feedback and insight on our service and your experience.  We enjoy working with you and the community.

review_text: Attempted a simple phone call to look for a missing payment, after 8 minutes on hold, I'm connected to an answering service to take a message.. horrible customer service.
owner_answer:
Philip-
We are sorry to see your review and apologize for the delay on hold. We will track this down in our call logs to see what caused the delay. We strive to return all non-emergency phone calls within 24 hours and will call you back as soon as possible.

If you have a simple request about your account balance, we provide an online portal for all associations so that you can access your information online at https://web.mycmg.com. If you do not have your login credentials, please send an email to help@mycmg.com with our association name and property address, and we'll be happy to reset your account password for you.

review_text: As a homeowner having to deal with this management company And the customer service they provide, one of the worst I have personally dealt with. Do not expect to be able to speak with someone when you call, you will only get the answering service. Do not expect a return phone call after leaving a message. Do not expect a return to email messages as well. Very poor service, no one should use this Group if other options are available.
owner_answer:
Oh no! We're so sorry that you've had a negative experience! It is our goal to always deliver exceptional support! We are experiencing higher than normal call volumes, each message is normally responded to within 48 hours.

We do show that you were actually able to reach out on our live chat platform. Thank you for using this tool! There are currently no hold times for live chat. Thank you for following the instructions that our agent provided to you! Our team will be responding to your email today!

Please don't hesitate to reach out if there is anything else we can assist you with!

R Gunter, we hate to see that you have not had a positive experience. In order to assist you, we will need the name of your association and your property address.  We don't show your name "Gunter" in our voicemail/messages history. Our Community Support Team is required to return all calls, if your call was not returned, please reach out to us as soon as possible to let us know so that we may identify the possible issue.

We do have agents ready and available to assist via live chat. Simply visit www.mycmg.com and click on the "Chat With Us" button to chat with one of our Community Support Agents.

Live Chat hours are
8am - 6:30pm Monday - Thursday
8am - 2pm on Friday

Alternatively, please give us a call at (877) 252-3327 or email us at help@mycmg.com

review_text: I have been involved with our Board and community for almost six years.  I was a committee chairperson and lead the social program prior to becoming a Board member two years ago.  I wanted to say how helpful Scott and the Cedar team have been in getting our community on the right track. We first retained Cedar in 2012 and based on other Board member feedback they put together a plan to help us decrease our accounts receivable and get our community looking better.  Our issue at the time was that the previous management company had not helped our Board understand options regarding collections and outstanding balances from homeowners.  Not having the appropriate funds our Board and committees were unable to make the decision to maintain our common elements and continue to improve our community.  With the effort of the accounting team and the association attorney we made strides to improve our collection rate and get our budget under control.  This lead to additional uncollected funds begin collected and used to improve our pool area and play ground.  Cedar also assisted our community in the NC grant program and with their help we were able to receive grant money for our new park area and improvements to our main community entrance.  Since being on the Board the progress has continued and we have enjoyed working with our manager and other Cedar team members to develop strategies for our community that ensure we will have a bright future ahead.  Thank you to our manager, Holly and the entire Cedar team for the hard work and effort over the past 4 years. We are excited to work with you in the future.
owner_answer: Thank you Brenda.  We appreciate your feedback and were excited about the grant funding for the community.  We look forward to working together and will share your feedback with Scott, Holly and the Cedar team.

review_text: By far the worst HOA Management company.  Wont even take my money for HOA fees.  Who doesn't take cash.  WOW.
owner_answer:
Mike,
We hate to see the negative review. We have never accepted cash for HOA dues payments and have many reasons for doing so. Accepting cash payments creates liability issues, increases probability for accounting errors, and creates a safety issue for our employees as cash based businesses are at greater risk for a potential robbery.

We offer multiple payment options including check, money order, ACH draft, and online payments. If you do not want to write a check, you can use your bank's online bill pay service and they will send a check on your behalf.

If you would like more information or have further questions, please email us at help@mycmg.com and we'll be happy to assist you.

review_text:
Absolutely horrible. Spent 30 minutes trying to get help setting up our first autopay and was told conflicting information over and over again - they were literally talking in circles. I mailed my form in by the deadline yet they failed to deduct the payment from my account and sent me a bill. When I logged in online to set up autopay and to pay the bill manually, the website didn't even work and they can't find my account at all. I called them and spent well over 5 minutes waiting on their VOICEMAIL SERVICE. I've left a message for a callback but have low expectations at this point. RIDICULOUS, unprofessional process, website, and staff.

Update! 04/16/2020: Trying to contact CMG to update incorrect account number they're using to draft my payments. Have been trying for over a week, and have been given 4 different contacts within the company, none of which communicate with each other or have been able to help. They keep stressing I have to make the changes by the 20th YET NO ONE WILL HELP ME DO SO
owner_answer:
Katherine-
We are sorry to hear about your experience. We received your message about why your October payment was not drafted. Because we took over for the association effective October 1st, we are not able to process ACH draft the first month of managing your association.

On the welcome letter that we sent, it stated that we must receive the ACH forms by the 20th of the month in order for the ACH draft to take effect the following month. We did not receive your ACH draft form until 10/22, which is past the deadline for us to be able to draft in November.

We tried to call you this morning at approximately 8:30AM and left a voice message.

If you have questions about your account, please feel free to email us at help@mycmg.com and be sure to include the name of your association and property address.

review_text: Cedar management hasn't provided any service in our development. However,  they want to charge and the p.o box address is always suspicious.  Haven't raked one leaf or maintained anything.  Horrible
owner_answer:
Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback, Camilo. We're so sorry that you feel this way! Our goal is the total satisfaction of our communities, and to provide a positive experience to homeowners.

We use a P.O. box because it has many benefits to our homeowners and communities. It provides speed, privacy, security, convenience and mobility. P.O. box mail is often delivered earlier in the day than mail at a home or business and packages are kept safe and secure until they are picked up.

We do have a physical address as well if you'd prefer to come visit us!

9500 Statesville Road, Charlotte, NC 28269
Google Maps Link -> https://maps.google.com/maps?cid=11764293324402802039

Also, unfortunately our company does not offer raking services directly. Your community's Board of Directors would be the authority on approving a maintenance vendor to go out to complete that work. You can assist your community by submitting maintenance requests to maintenance@mycmg.com with details of the maintenance concerns. Please be sure to include the name of your association and property address so that we can assist you.

review_text:
Update 10/20/20:. First impression was correct. I got fed up with them and took back our HOA.  I am now the President of our self managed HOA.

10/6/19:  The day after I posted this I received a very nice and concerned call from Management.  I was impressed to receive the call and very appreciative for it.  I received payment for 4 out of 5 invoices the day after that and by the date of the checks it was not due to my initial post.  Hopefully the accounting issues have been worked out and it will be smooth sailing hereon out.  Rating upgraded from one to 3 stars.

AWFUL HOA Management Co.  Management?  There is none.  I am a homeowner & a vendor that bills them every 2 weeks for common area maintenance.  I've been paid 3 times since April and each time I've had to email and phone constantly to be paid.  As of this writing, I still haven't been paid for five invoices!
owner_answer:
Dawn-
We are sorry to hear about this experience and we appreciate your time on the phone today. The property manager for your association will be following up with you to address these concerns.

To help expedite the payment process, please be sure to include your company name (or at least your name), mailing address, and contact information on all future invoices.

If you have additional questions, please contact us directly so that we can assist you.

review_text: Highly advise not to go to this group. No communication with residents and no warning if they send your stuff to collections. ($175 fee)
owner_answer:
Madelaine-

We understand you are upset about being sent to an attorney's office for unpaid dues. Please understand that we keep communication logs of all homeowner inquiries and our records show that we have made several communication attempts with you about your dues AND you called our offices inquiring about your dues back in March.

On 1-16-19 we sent a welcome letter that had instructions for how to pay your dues and access your account information through our portal.
On 2-28-19 we sent the billing
On 3-14-19 you called our office inquiring why your HOA dues were $110
On 3-21-19 we sent a past due / demand notice
On 4-20-19 we sent another account statement

In addition to the communications that we sent, you also had access to your account 24/7 through our web portal (this will be restored once your account is settled). In the future, please do not ignore communications about your association and your HOA fees.

review_text: I would like to thank Paul, Julie and the entire Cedar staff for their support since our transition almost a year ago.  I am the President of our community which consist of a mix of patio homes, single family homes and condominiums.  Our manager is Tracey and she has been fantastic to work with.  The follow up and attention to detail has allowed our Board of Directors to focus on more important issues.   With almost 600 homes in our community and a tremendous amount of ammenties, we have plenty to keep ourselves busy.  Our monthly reports are detailed and very easy to read and understand.  Having backup documentation in electronic format is also very helpful and has allowed us to be more focused on expenses and the budgeting process for the upcoming year.  We also enjoy the no cost owner portal and website.  This has allowed our owners to be able to access information real time and has reduced the amount of questions we receive as a Board from our fellow owners. Cedar has assisted us in reviewing our insurance for cost savings and was able to cut those cost by almost two thousand dollars.  We have added a key fob system at our pool and improved security for our clubhouse and tennis court areas.  We have reduce legal expenses and most of our our administration cost have been reduce by almost 75%, compared to our previous management company.   Making the decision to change companies was not an easy one for our Board of Directors, but I am glad we did make the change.  I highly recommend Cedar Management Group to those communities who are searching more a more proactive, customer focused management company.  The client experience is top notch and we are extremely pleased to work with them each day.
owner_answer: Jon, thank you for taking the time to post information about your experience with our company.  We will share this with our staff and Tracey.  We look forward to continuing to work with you and your community in the future.

review_text:
I usually don't post reviews, but I couldn't help myself.  The interesting thing is that the issues I'm running into, I realize that others experienced these same issues.  The payment processing for Cedar is flawed.  I've never had so many issues trying to give my money to anyone in my life.

I currently use Auto Bill Pay through my banking system, which I use for quite a few recurring bills, which performs an Auto Check that is sent on the 1st of every month.  Typically these payments can take up to 1-3 business days to process before I see the money pulled from the account.

In February of this year my wife noticed that our account showed that we owed double the amount that we normally pay month-to-month, so I called Cedar Management Group to ask why I was being double-billed.  What we found is that the payment for October's fees that are set to Auto Pay on the first day of each month got kicked back to my account for the payment scheduled for November 1st.  I called Cedar Management Group and was told that the payment was probably bounced back because there wasn't an assessment charged or in at that time.  So essentially my account balance was at $0 at the time that my payment was sent, so it was returned.  Since I have auto-payment set up I never noticed that this happened, especially since this has NEVER happened with any of my other bills.

At that time I asked if I could just go ahead and send a payment so that I could get my balance down to $0, but the person on the phone couldn't help me.  They did say I could pay online or over the phone but I would be charged a service fee and percentage for doing that.  I told them that I would just like to pay my balance without having to be charged a fee for an issue with their payment system.  The other thing I did was adjust my Auto-Bill Payment to pay on the 3rd of each month to avoid the issue with their system bouncing my money back after I try to pay them.  If it would be better for them and make it so I don't have to worry about my money not being accepted I am willing to set up ACH and have the money pulled from the account each month without having to worry about writing a check or thinking that the system will not accept my money.  The problem is that the account has to be $0 and apparently they can't help me pay this without having to charge some sort of fee.

I don't think it's right to charge a late payment for an account that we can't even pay early on, and that I have an auto-payment set up for.  The worst part is that I wasn't even notified that the payment was bounced back in the first place, so it was up to me to report it to Cedar and then in turn they charged us a late fee.

The other thing I noticed is that even after my bank shows the money coming out and being accepted by Cedar, their systems still don't show that it has been paid.  My Auto-Bill pay shows that it was sent on 4/3 and accepted and pulled from my account on 4/4.  I just got off the phone with a nice lady who told me she doesn't see any payment showing in her system.

Please feel free to contact me and let me know if you have any questions.  I really just want to be able to pay my bill and not have to worry about being charged late fees for issues on the backend.
owner_answer:
Sean-

We are sorry to hear about your concern and appreciate you taking time to explain your situation. We have your contact information and will have someone  reach out to help you get this resolved and remove the late fees from your account. In the future, if you need assistance, please send an email to help@mycmg.com and we'll happy to assist you.

review_text:
The Worst to work with. Cedar Management’s Accounting department evidently don't have People who can perform or understand maintaining accounts. One issue that they truly need to work on is posting payments on date of receipt and not the date of processing bulk of payments. This is what causes late fees no matter if payment is sent a week or two in advance or in person.

I was selling my property and I had a small balance on my account.  I paid the balance to zero on the same day the closing rep requested the HOA information so the balance still showed. As a result, when I closed I had to again pay the small balance in my closing cost. I tried to have the rep take my proof that my account had no outstanding balance, but was told Cedar Management would charge $100 to update the document since the request would be needed in less than three days. I knew it would be an issue if my refund was left to Cedar Management to return. And guess what, it was. Although I paid this company twice I was told there is no overpayment and my account shows no balance. So my question is, did they not keep documentation of what they sent out In order to ensure all monies were received and accounted for accordingly?  My answer is, No because if they had then my account would have been credited the overpayment to be refunded. Although I showed Cedar Management the documentation I was still told they don’t owe me anything. I believe this is a result of their staff not understanding documents they request. This company has no clue what they are doing?  I'm so happy I don't have to deal with them anymore but I want this issue to be resolved as I'm only asking for what I'm owed.

Follow up - I appreciate someone taking the time to review my account after going back and forth. I've received notice that I will be sent a check for my overpayment-Thank you. I feel all this could have been eliminated if someone would have been available to discuss issues and not rely on back and forth emails or having the customer service reps to handle calls that they can not assist on due to a department issue. Although i m happy this will be taken care of, it doesn't resolve my experience on posted payments in an untimely fashion. More n be done to ensure customer service when handling people financials on one of the biggest purchases people make, their home.
owner_answer:
Tamika-

We are sorry to hear about your experience. Occasionally mistakes happen - and we admit it when we make them. And in this case, it looks like we made a mistake. We had informed you that a refund would be issued back when the check cleared. However, we were missing the HUD statement and did not realize it. When you followed- up on April 17th, we immediately started working to correct the mistake. By Monday April 22nd, everything was cleared up and a refund check was sent back to you.

We would appreciate an acknowledgement from you and updating or removing your review. Please let us know if we can assist you further.

review_text: I do not often post reviews online but I wanted to share a great experience as there is so much negativity in this world. I have been in the customer service industry all my life, and am very demanding when it comes to customer service. I am a homeowner in an HOA managed by Cedar and got a violation letter in the mail. I called Cedar today to discuss the violation. They explained in detail what the violation was over the phone, then by the time the call was over, I had an email with the photo of my violation included. It was my fault – I didn’t realize our neighborhood did not allow certain things n the front yard. The email from the customer service person even had the section of our documents highlighted so that I could tell right off that I was in violation. I have since corrected this and all is well. The person I spoke with was very polite and professional – not to mention my issue was resolved in minutes. I was barely even on hold before they picked up. I also like that they asked for my phone number and email to update their records – I’m going to implement that with my team at work as well. I must add that I was not an upset or irate person on the phone, and I think that has something to do with it too. You receive what you give in this world sometimes.

EDIT AND UPDATE: 24 hours after emailing the email they provided and still no update about the billing issues from Cedar Management.

EDIT: Nearly two weeks later and still no response or fix to this issue. STAY AWAY FROM CEDAR MANAGEMENT GROUP.
owner_answer: Nevan- we appreciate your concerns and understand you are upset. All late fees from your account were removed earlier this year. It is also our policy to not hang up on a client unless an owner has made a threat against the company or their association, at which point we advise them that all communication must be sent in writing going forward. Every call to our office is logged and recorded. If you can contact us with the date and time you called, we would be happy to investigate this issue to find out what happened. Please email us at help@mycmg.com with your concerns and we'll be happy to resolve them for you.

review_text: This group manages the HOA for my neighborhood. I have been a homeowner for less than a year and my experience so far has been fairly dismal! The portal doesn't seem to work causing payments to be missed. Customer service is a nightmare long wait times, weird hours and no call returns. The fees are going up yet I don't see any improvements. Consider themselves to be one of the best property management groups, but I wish my HOA would reconsider!
owner_answer: Hi Andrew- We are sorry to hear about your experience. If you have had any issues with your payments or the web portal, please let us know. As far as fee increases are concerned, your HOA dues are based on your association's budget. The board prepares the budget which is approved at your annual meeting. Please send us an email at help@mycmg.com with your community name and we'll be happy to assist you

review_text: Casey Joye is a true pleasure.
owner_answer: Thank you for your review, Heather! We agree! It is truly our pleasure to serve your community.

review_text: Our community and HOA Board have been very pleased with the professional services Cedar Management has provided for us over the past decade.  We have a good and strong relationship.  They are providing us with great community support services.  We would highly recommend Cedar Management.
owner_answer: Steve - Thank you for providing feedback regarding our over 10 years of service to your community.  We are so privileged to be able to work with you, the Board and community in continuing to improve property values and build on the great community spirit.  We will share your comments with our staff and we look forward to our partnership in the future.

review_text: Really happy with Cedar's service in taking care of the community where I live. I travel often, but they are easy to communicate anytime I need to pay dues or get hold of my property manager.

My community recently switched to CMG and it has been a NIGHTMARE ever since. As a new homeowner, I had received a login and welcome packet through the previous company (back in MARCH) with all dues/fees being paid. One day at the end of MAY I tried to log in and find that I now cannot because CMG has taken over. Contact them and they have no record of me being the new owner (which I thought was the previous company's fault at first) nor was anything ever sent out saying there was a switch!!

Fast forward to the end of JUNE with back and forth with these people AND the previous company, I have still not heard a reply about fees ALREADY PAID being removed from my account. They e-mailed me today, but it was another residents information!!! Talk about a privacy violation and they still have not gotten back to me about my account, even after the old company reached out to them three days ago. I've talked to maybe 6-7 different people between both companies and it is absolutely ridiculous. My original welcome letter said previous balance was "0.00" and now I get my HOA fees for 3rd quarter with an additional 400+ fee on there? DESPITE SENDING THEM MULTIPLE MULTIPLE MULTIPLE e-mails with my closing documents. Again, this is completely not a user error as everything was already updated and good to go per the other company MONTHS AGO. So why am I having this issue? And why are they e-mailing me another resident's information? GET IT TOGETHER CMG.

This so called company has NO ORGANIZATIONAL EFFECTIVENESS in their processes for assisting home owners. There is no communication, no follow-up AND NO efforts in place to resolve issues or put in place methods to insure the properties they manage are suitable for on-site residents paying their mortgages and/or association dues. The company is a complete waist and should be sued.
owner_answer:
Eric, we are sorry to hear you feel this way. We understand that there are some issues with your account not being up-to-date with the association. In regards to your statement about not having methods to ensuring payments can be made: we offer multiple payment options for homeowners to pay their dues including check, ACH draft, and credit card payments. Payments can be sent through your bank, made in person at our office, or online at www.mycmg.com.

In regards to the communications and follow-up, we sent multiple notices for you to contact our office so that we could help you make arrangements and we have documented records of the notices that have been sent out. Unfortunately we never got a response from you.

In regards to your mortgage, we do not offer assistance in paying mortgages or making mortgage payments. This is not the management company or the HOA's responsibility. You will need to contact your lender to make appropriate arrangements with them to pay your mortgage.

review_text: This company dose not see the value in up keep and continued maintenance of the properties under there belts, there so many issues in Apple gate, that they continue to turn the other cheek, that it robs the hard working, caring home owners of the property value, as they allow the renters/ home owners who do not care to do the right thing by there neighbors to continue on and extremely divalue the neighborhood.
owner_answer: Warren- We sorry to hear you feel this way. We conduct regular inspections of your community and work with your board of directors to enforce your association's covenants. We do not "turn the other cheek" or blatantly ignore residents who do not maintain their properties. If you have specific concerns, please email us at help@mycmg.com so we can work with your board of directors to address any issues you have in the community.

review_text: Gregory eitheror is the best help ????????????

I will be submitting my application to run for our local HOA Board to fire this company and bring in another!

review_text: Erin has exceptional customer service!!

review_text: I want to thank Allison Robinson for her exceptional professionalism during our interactions.

review_text: Stay away from this company.  They are the worst!  Our HOA had Cedar Management represent us a couple of years ago.  We fired them after a little over a year.  Today, I received a call about a bill that was not paid on our HOA's behalf by Cedar under their tenure.  I pulled up several emails that I sent to our Cedar rep (Amanda) at the time demanding that Cedar make the payment.  Unbeknownst to me, the bill was never paid.  Cedar needs to be micromanaged by the HOA's that have hired them to "manage" to make sure that they are actually performing the duties that they were hired to do in the first place.  I am sure that there will be a response by Cedar denying culpability (the one thing that they are good at).  I too, question the 5 star reviews.  It is my belief that Cedar has their staff spending too much time generating false reviews when they should have their staff spending their time doing what HOA's have hired them to do in the first place.
owner_answer:
Craig-
We are sorry to hear this. We cannot comment publicly about your association. If there are any questions you have about the financial records for your association, please email us at help@mycmg.com with your association name and we'll be happy to investigate this issue for you.

review_text:
*** ** an update- Cedar property contacted me by phone today and were very kind and sympathetic to my situation. She has agreed to intervene in pushing my app thru to alleviate our wait time. She said would personally try and expedite the process. It does not change the previous situation. But it absolutely means alot to be taken seriously and show concern and care!
So far our interactions with this group trying to get a shed put in our back yard has been frustrating to no end and no end in sight. We have called in and went to their office in person to submit our application and was told they could not accept it that we would have to snail mail it or scan it and email it, that they could not accept the application in person.  We submitted a request for a shed, got denied and the answer we were given in the denial letter was a cut and paste of what is in our neighborhood CCR's, 3 paragraphs worth of everything!
When I called in to ask why we were denied she said I would have to email back in and request that they give us specifics as to why.  What ??? You deny an application but don't tell us what for?  So frustrating and the Board of Directors for our neighborhood have NO contact information or anyone to talk to just a PO Box ? This is my 1st experience with an HOA and it will be my last. When we sell we wont be moving into a development ever again.
owner_answer:
Angela, we are sorry to hear about your frustrations. However, it appears that your frustrations are with your HOA and not our company and we would ask that you please remove this review.

The reason we request an email for ARC applications is because we keep everything documented for legal purposes. When you emailed us, we did specify the reason that your ARC committee denied the request. We have copied that portion of the email below for your reference.

"The ARC Committee stated that your shed does not meet the guidelines because it does not match the existing color of the home and would need to have a shingled roof to match the home as well."

If you have additional questions or concerns, please email us at help@mycmg.com and we'll be happy to assist you. In the meantime, we ask that you please consider revising or removing your negative review.

Thank you.

review_text: Erin Lewis was very helpful.
owner_answer: Thank you for your review, Nicholas! It is truly our pleasure to serve your community.

review_text: 3rd time  they put my property through foreclosure because they refuse to send  issue via email!!!!!!   Cost me from 500-6,0000 each time.  Anyone ready for class action please contact me.  They need to be sued.   They are trying to steal our property.
owner_answer:
Gen, we are sorry to hear about your frustrations on this. We can send past due notices via mail and email and your association also has a web portal that allows you to access your account balance.

However, if there is no communication regarding a delinquent payment, the association can choose to take legal action for collecting payment and will turn over a homeowner to an attorney's office to ensure that all legal requirements are followed for collecting the debt for the past due fees.

In the future, please ensure that your HOA dues are paid in a timely manner to avoid any potential late fees or legal fees.

We cannot comment publicly about your specific about history. If you have any questions, please contact us at help@mycmg.com and we'll be happy to assist you.
