We are here to help and assist and work on behalf of your community.  Thank you for allowing us to provide feedback.

review_text: As a member of our Social Committee and ARC Board, I am happy to highly endorse Cedar Management Group.  I have worked with them for over a year and have had no issues with communication, follow up or lack of focus.  Serving on our Board of Directors in the past and working with previous management companies, I can say Cedar has been able to deliver great service at a excellent price.  Our social committee is very active and we have enjoyed using the website to help track our events and up-coming activities.  I am also please with the review process for request for changes.  Those have been processed within 2 or 3 days of being received and the follow up on letting owners know if approved, etc. has also been fast and easy.   I want to thank Teresa, Cindy and Marcie for the hard work they have done for our community.
owner_answer: Tylor, thank you for the feedback.  We will share your comments with Teresa, Cindy and Marcie and our entire staff.  We look forward to working with you in the future.

review_text: Kudos to Cedar for being a honest and trustworthy management company. They have are always there to answer my calls and I never have issues getting hold of my property manager Susan.
owner_answer: Thank you Ben. We appreciate the feedback! We will pass this long to Susan and her supervisor.

review_text: Horrible management company. They love to fine and don’t respond to emails.
owner_answer:
Gary-
Sorry to hear you feel this way. We actually don't enjoy fining homeowners. However it's part of our job to help the board enforce the rules of the community. Please understand that fines are approved by your community's Board of Directors. Those fines are paid to your HOA. We have no benefit in fining a homeowner.

In regards to emails, we always respond to emails unless there's a problem - emails get caught by our spam filter, a homeowner makes threats or uses violent language, etc.

If you send us an email at help@mycmg.com with your community name and property address, we'll be happy to assist you.

review_text: Awful customer service, don’t leave a portion of your fence un stained for a week or they will fine you. Found it difficult to reach the proper people to do anything. Stay away if your looking for community HOA!
owner_answer:
Hi Darrin-

We are sorry to hear about your frustration and hate to see that you are leaving a negative review of our company when you have concerns about your HOA.

According to our records, we sent a letter back in January about this issue so it has been more than "a week." We also see where you emailed us on April 11th and we replied the same day that we would be looking into this for you.

We will have someone reach out to you to discuss your concerns.

review_text: The worst! All they care about is raising the HOA fee for no reason. They do zero upkeep to neighborhood that doesn’t even have a gate or pool and they raised it very steep. Front entrance looks terrible. Many solicitors even though non solicitation zone. Even worse they keep sending letter violations that aren’t for my house! Extremely disappointed. Wish my HOA did not switch. When you call they just say to email and they give no reply as to why the price increase.
owner_answer:
Claire- We hate to see that you are leaving a negative review because of a recent violation letter that you received. We understand you are frustrated and hopefully we can help you.

In regards to the "very steep" HOA fee increase - your Board of Directors is responsible for the budget and determining the HOA dues. Your HOA dues only increased by $5 from $140 to $145 per year. We're confused as to why you say this is "very steep." If you are concerned about the dues, we encourage you to speak with a board member in your community and attend the annual meeting for the association to address your concerns.

In regards to the solicitors - we have no control over their behavior. If your community has signs for "No Solicitation," then you can contact your local police department to have someone come out if you see solicitors in the neighborhood.

In regards to the community's upkeep -  We can assist with selecting landscaping vendors for the community however the Board is responsible for the services the association pays for.  If you have concerns about the appearance of your association, we encourage to reach out to your board or use the "Contact Your Board" form at www.mycmg.com.

In regards to the violation letters, we show a record of two violation letters - November 2018 and March 2018. The violation letter that was sent to your account for mildew and exterior cleaning was removed from your account. If you would like to dispute any violations, please send an email to help@mycmg.com with your association name and property address and we'll have the community manager review your request with your Board of Directors.

review_text: I called Cedar for a question and was able to get a hold of their community support division very quickly. (I’m so used to being put on hold anytime I call a business, so this was refreshing). I was able to get new payment coupons sent out. Very friendly support team.
owner_answer: Thank you Garrett.  We will share this with our support team.

review_text: This HOA comes attached to one's homes; impossible to detach from. I have been enjoying it's low customer service since 2006 and it just keeps getting worse but what can one do? only pay them and do their job too... that's just the way it is
owner_answer: Elsie- we understand your unsatisfied with your homeowners association. If you have concerns with your community, please contact us at help@mycmg.com with your property address so we can assist you.

review_text:
Our HOA recently switched over to Cedar. I wish they stayed with our previous company.

Long hold times, can't even get someone of the phone on any given weekday.

Their electronic bill payment system is a mess. And on top of that, they charge a transaction fee for debit/credit cards.

Terrible experience!
owner_answer:
Josh-

We're sorry to hear about your experience. We do occasionally experience longer hold times that normal. Typically these happen the first two weeks of the quarter due to the increased billing volumes. We also provide a web portal at no cost to your association that allows you to login and view your account. This information is provided on the invoice that we send to you as a homeowner.

Transaction fees are charged for credit and debit cards because Visa, Mastercard, AMEX, etc. all have fees that they charge to process payments on their network. The bank's processing fees are passed to the homeowner, otherwise, the association would be responsible for those fees. You do not pay transaction fees when you use your card in a store or a restaurant because the store is building their costs into to the purchase price of the product you are buying.

We offer a variety of payment options to pay your dues. We provide ACH draft for free. You can also use online bill pay through your personal bank's website for free. Just put the name of your association as the payee and be sure to include your account number in the memo field.

In the future, if you would like to contact us, we encourage you to call or email us at help@mycmg.com. If you need access to your account or account balance, we would encourage you to use the free web portal which you can access 24/7.

Thank you.

review_text:
Thanks to Nicole DeRiso she has got our community back on track.
Thanks for your hard work and being patient with us . As the VP of our complex we look forward to the up coming years.
owner_answer: Thank you! We appreciate your feedback and will let Nicole and our team know. Please let us know if we can ever be of assistance in the future.

review_text: This management company is horrible with handling concerns of homeowners. I’ve been trying to get a situation handled since 11/6/18 and nothing has been figured out. I called Tuesday and left a message for the property manager of my community and still have not received a telephone call back, but no surprises it has happened before. I keep getting the same response, that the vendor has be contacted. 2 months later and the vendor has not been out. I’ve had problems with this company too many times since I’ve bought my home in Feb 2018. They want you to pay your dues on time but won’t try to handle request in a timely manner. Please do better since you’re getting my dues every month!!
owner_answer: Talaya- We understand your concerns. If this is in regards to the hedges that were removed, this was authorized by the board in November. Bushes and hedges are the association's responsibility to maintain in your community. The board ordered them to be removed. They have also authorized new ones to be installed to replace them. New bushes are typically best planted in the early Spring or early Fall. They were not installed in November because plants start becoming dormant around this time. If you have any questions about this, please contact us at help@mycmg.com and we'll be happy to assist you.

review_text: Kris has been very caring about our community recently. She has answered all of the board's questions promptly and professionally. She has made the whole experience of working with Cedar excellent. Great person to work with.

I am very pleased with the customer service that Cedar provides. Especially their attention to detail and their quick response whenever I call. Errol is our property manager - he is wonderful to work with and very knowledgeable. I know this because I have lived in a neighborhood managed by Cedar for more than 5 years. I can tell you they are very professional and courteous to our community.
owner_answer: Thanks for the positive feedback.  We appreciate it and are always here to assist you.

review_text: Casey is wonderful and very professional
owner_answer: Thank you for the encouragement, Stephanie! We've shared your kind words with Casey as well!

review_text: Sandra is a breath of fresh air for our community. Serving on a the board of directors for the last 6 years I know all the details that really go into managing a community. She's super knowledgeable and great with follow throughs. Very open to input from the board and kind in her communication.
owner_answer: Marcus, thank you for sending this note.  We appreciate your comments and will share with Sandra and our team.

review_text:
Cedar has been so helpful with the transition from our old management company.
They are hands-down the most responsive company we have been managed by.
Every time we call we are politely greeted and that really goes a long way.
Would recommend them to any community looking to transition into new management.
owner_answer: Thanks John.  We appreciate the feedback.

review_text: I wrote a review about a month ago on Cedar and since then they have provided great customer service.  The president of the group contacted me personally and reimbursed me fairly for the issues that I had previously.  I appreciate them following up and making good on the issue we had.  Great Management Group!
owner_answer: Thanks Darius!

review_text: Cedar came on as our management company in late September and we can tell a huge difference. As the board president I was getting used to 50 calls a week from residents, but now Cedar has been able to handle all questions and concerns. Very pleased.
owner_answer: Andrew - Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We appreciate you sharing and will continue to work hard on behalf of the community.

review_text:
I have been reading reviews about CMG for quite some time to confirm I am not alone when stating CMG's property managers and payment system are indeed flawed. When hired, CMG introduced us a property manager who lives in Raleigh; yet, our property is located in Greensboro. To date owners do not know who is managing our property and receive the run-around when making an effort o reach the individual via telephone. Based on the conditions of my building and its landscape (see attached images), I withheld my HOA fees this past fall as an attempt to force the HOA to conduct major repairs. Eventually, I began paying my outstanding balance December 2018 to avoid being one of the "Dead Beats" I complain about with my neighbors; yet, $183 remained unpaid as of January 1, 2019. CMG's attorney made an attempt to notify me via certified mail only for me to make an online payment that same night wherein I paid the entire balance January 25th. The law firm released my account as of February 6, 2019; yet, a block remains present to date that is preventing me from making an online payment.

Now, when I made a large payment December 2018, I completed CMG's Automatic Draft document granting them permission to withdraw monthly payments at the beginning of each month from my checking account. I was informed by CMG the account needed to be current in order for the Automatic Draft payment plan to become active, so why did CMG fail to activate it at the beginning of February? Not only was a block present for the online payment option, my account remained flagged at CMG's office after its attorney submitted a legal document declaring my account was current on February 6, 2019. Concerned that my account would become delinquent, I mailed a bank check to CMG via certified mail to pay for both February and March dues near the end of March because CMG declined to speak with me to resolve the matter due to my account being flagged by their error. Once CMG responded via email, they declared I owed for both March and April 2019 only. To confirm I owed for April 2019 only, I submitted pictures of the $450 bank check, envelope, and the apple shaped memo that was enclosed stating my situation. Eventually, CMG acknowledged the $450 check being applied to my account only to distribute an April 2019 invoice stating  I owed over $700 for April 2018 (refer to attached image). I cannot take this company serious.

As of today, I have made four attempts during the month of April alone to have the block removed so I can make an online payment for the month, and the problem remains unsolved. Legal associates of the law firm CMG uses to collect outstanding dues have been copied on my emails and they have yet to respond either. I have never experienced such unethical and unprofessional service from a property management company until CMG was hired. Based on the reviews I have read the past three months, CMG clearly has a major flaw in its Finance Department wherein individual accounts are not being updated in a timely manner.

After reading multiple reviews, I have noticed how CMG responds to negative Google reviews quicker than answering telephone calls from homeowners- and ALWAYS have a slick response! Since pictures speak a thousand words, I decided to upload several images to validate my complaint since CMG is not capable of resolving the matter via email. Whether the HOA made the decision to avoid repairing major building code violations until the City of Greensboro was notified or not, CMG is being paid to inspect the conditions of the buildings monthly in addition to prioritizing major repairs and maintenance to assure the safety of all individuals residing on the property. I truly appreciate a former renter informing the owners in my building of our rights to notify the City of Greensboro Code Compliance Department in order to have building code violations resolved in a timely manner.

If you are reading this review while considering hiring CMG to manage your community, please consider hiring another company for certain.
owner_answer:
Angela- We are sorry to hear about your concerns with the association. We work with your board of directors to maintain your community. However, all repairs and landscaping work must be authorized by the board before we can release the funds for the repairs to be made.  In regards to your specific account and outstanding balance, we cannot comment publicly on it. However, you still have an outstanding balance. Please email us at help@mycmg.com with your name, association name, and property address so that we can assist you.

Thank you.

review_text: Tracy Hines has been very helpful in getting our website transferred over while switching management companies to Cedar. We were able to keep all of our records and it was super beneficial to our board and community as a whole.
owner_answer: Thank you Jacob.  We will share with our team.

review_text: They are a scam. Stealing people's homes. Thank you for making another vet homeless over  being 1000 behind as I catch my mortgage up and now they sold my house for 5000. I owe 60000 and so they can take my house and give it away to someone else's and yet So they get a free house and I get the Debt. this is theft plan and simple. And how much was my hoa that t had payed for 10 years. 60 bucks a month for what.i might add for one trash can. That's it. That didn't cut our grass they dont clean the ulgutters or fix the busted water main that's been busted for 3 years. But thank you America for making another vet homeless so you can make a profit.
owner_answer:
Joey- We are truly sorry to hear about this unfortunate circumstance. Our company and your HOA does not have any financial benefit in the foreclosure of your home.

Your Board of Directors govern the association and entrust us to fairly and consistently uphold the rules of the community, which you legally agree to when you purchase a home in an HOA.

Unfortunately we cannot comment publicly on your specific situation. However, we can say that we made multiple attempts to contact you to try and resolve the situation. We also offer payment plans in an effort to help delinquent owners. Multiple notices and warnings are sent and also mailed via certified mail before a foreclosure is issued. We make every reasonable effort we can but ultimately the Board of Directors in your community have to make tough decisions like this when a homeowner does not respond.

If you have additional questions, please send us an email at help@mycmg.com.

review_text: Casey Joye was very knowledgeable
owner_answer: Thank you for the review, Deborah! We'll share your kind words with Casey as well!

review_text: Casey Joye is the best!
owner_answer: We think our clients are the best! Thank you for the 5-star review! We've shared your encouraging words with Casey too!

review_text: My experience last week with my management company was great!  I had an issue, I called spoke with someone immediately and from that point I had a response by noon the next day. I will will from past experience with another management company I was not expecting much BUT Cedar surprised me completely with their experienced people from the young lady that answered the phone to the young man that handled the issue. Thanks Cedar!
owner_answer: Julie -Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We are delighted that we were able to be of great help.  Thanks for allowing us to serve you.

review_text: Thank you Erin Lewis! Great!!
owner_answer: Thank you for your 5-star review! Our mission is to have the best trained professional staff available! Your words are so encouraging to see!

review_text:
Our yearly HOA dues for Hackberry Place are due 1/1. Cedar charged our HOA $147 in November 2018 for mailing out the invoices. Problem is, NOBODY in the ENTIRE community received an invoice. Cedar is refusing to give me my balance when I call them. I'm not a deadbeat, I'm TRYING to pay my bill, and they are refusing to mail anyone an invoice or tell us how much they owe.

A petition to remove board members was submitted to Cedar according to our bylaws. Cedar is refusing to call a meeting for the vote.

We pay Cedar for 4 community meetings per year, and there's been ZERO meetings in the past 14 months.

They NEVER return your call, no matter how many messages you leave.

COMPLETE SCAM - DO NOT USE THIS MANAGEMENT COMPANY.
owner_answer:
Jessica-
Thank you for contacting us about your concerns. There are no owners in the community for Hackberry Place named Jessica Franklin.

We do not refuse to give balances to homeowners or refuse to return calls unless a homeowner has made threats against the company. In these cases, we give multiple warnings beforehand. However, if an owner continues to make verbal or legal threats against our staff, we are not allowed to speak on the phone and all communication must be in writing.

This has only happened with one homeowner in Hackberry Place. So if this happens to be you, this would explain why you are not getting returns to your calls. Please understand that we gave you multiple warnings to stop using profanity and to calm down so that we could speak with you about your concerns and yet you did not listen.

In regards to your special meeting to remove the board, we did not refuse to call the meeting. This is false information. We sent out the notices for the meeting this week and the meeting will occur on January 28th.

The reason for the lack of meetings is not the fault of our company, but because of internal issues with the board which we cannot comment on publicly.

If you have questions about your account and we are not allowed to speak with you on the phone, please emails us at help@mycmg.com for assistance and we can respond in writing. Please note that we will NOT respond to threatening or profane messages.

review_text: Spoke with Greg concerning issues I’ve had and I couldn’t get over how patient and how amazing his customer service was thanks again Greg !
owner_answer: We can't get over it either! Thank you, Jaylyn, for your kind review! If you have any further concerns, please don't ever hesitate to reach out. It is truly our pleasure to serve.

review_text: We love having Nicole as our property manager, she is seriously the sweetest and she really does care about our community. The board felt like we were just another number in their system. She listens to our concerns and helps us with all the ins-and-outs that come with being on an HOA board.
owner_answer: Thank you Ivan, we will share your comments with Nicole.  We appreciate the feedback and time.

review_text:
I reported a violation to this company about a vehicle running their noisy engine at night in our neighborhood and disturbing our sleep.  They responded that they did not have authority over the roads in the neighborhood.
When I asked them for the copy of the covenant and sent them the section that applied - they responded with another excuse that the owner, (whose address is in our neighborhood), was "not a part of the community," and they had no authority over them.  Then I responded by showing them again a part of the covenant that states home owners are automatically members of the community.  They have not responded and refuse to do anything.  I called the police over the weekend and the officer addressed the noise issue, but, he confirmed that the HOA should address the vehicle parking in front of our house (which is why we can hear the noise at night so loudly).  I dont know if the rediculous responses are being fed to us from our HOA via cedar management- or just from cedar management alone - but it seems to me this management company is extremely useless.  I dont understand why we are forced to go through a management company that can provide us our covenant but cant read the covenant.  It's so sad that we pay HOA dues for this community, and yet when there is an issue, we are completely disregarded and fed lies and excuses to make us go away.
owner_answer: Hi Rachel- We're sorry to hear about your experience. We tried searching your name in our database to find your contact information but it's not pulling up. Can you please email us as help@mycmg.com with your name, community name, and a good number to reach you? We would be happy to have your property manager call you to discuss this further so we can resolve this issue for you.

review_text: We have thoroughly enjoyed Cedar managing our neighborhood in Gaston County. Cedar inspects our neighborhood twice a month for violations and we have seen a tremendous turnaround in compliance. We struggled with a board and previous HOA not enforcing the rules like they should have been and it left us with a horrible looking community. Thankfully Cedar has the staff to help guide our new board in enforcing the rules. No one likes to get violation letters, but it has certainly cleaned up our community. And it's about dang time. Thanks Cedar.

I was pleasantly surprised when we switched over to Cedar and the amount of help we received. They helped us with accounts receivable, accounts payable, and managing all communication between the homeowners and the board.
owner_answer: Thank you Natalia! We appreciate your feedback.

review_text: very bad very bad experience with this worst management company. It is 100%a waste of money.
owner_answer:
Yue,
We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. Your HOA fees go to your association, not to our company. We would be happy to speak with you about your concerns. Please email us at help@mycmg.com with your association name and property address and we’ll be happy to assist you.

Update: Yue, we have searched our database and cannot find any records matching your information.

review_text: Casey Joye is awesome!
owner_answer: Thank you for the review, Layla! We think so too!

review_text: My lawyer mailed them legal papers to sue them, and they are refusing to accept the papers, they returned them to sender. The call center repeatedly hangs up on you - I have all calls recorded as proof. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS.
owner_answer: Please feel free to contact our office at help@mycmg.com.  We will do all we can to assist you.

review_text: Another successful start to summer !  Thank you Cedar for working so hard on our pool improvements and the advice on the best pool access system to purchase and install.  Our pool facility is now more secure and the reporting the system offers is very helpful to our pool committee.  As an added benefit, our outstanding assessments are at their lowest point in 5 years.
owner_answer: Cindy - Great news.  Thanks for the feedback.

review_text: Our experiences with the Cedar Management group based in Charlotte have been very poor. We have found this particular group to be unprofessional, uncommunicative, and unwilling to assist when called upon.
owner_answer:
Hi Christie-
We are sorry to hear about the negative review. We have not received any recent communication from you other than a recent violation letter that was sent. We will have someone contact you to discuss your concerns. If you have any questions, please feel free to email us at help@mycmg.com. Be sure to include your community name and property address for fastest response.

review_text: I've owned my home for 9 years and I'm not sure where all of these "glowing" reviews are coming from. I suppose if I lived in a neighborhood on a different side of town, my experience would be better but alas, that's not the case. Our community lights have been out since before Christmas 2017. I called to complain and was told (by a very friendly representative) that "a ticket has been requested by the Board" and Cedar is waiting on approval. Really? The lights are out. Have been out for going on 2 months. What a joke. I've called before about tall grass. Nothing happens. It's frustrating to pay HOA dues but when you have a valid complaint it takes months to get a response, if you get a response at all.
owner_answer: LeAndra - We are working with your board regarding the lighting issue.  We do appreciate your sharing any issues that you see. Let us know if we can be of any additional assistance by emailing us at help@mycmg.com.   Thank you.

review_text:
The budget Cedar prepared was confusing it had several items bunched together and the numbers were  incorrect...it lacked the usual detail.

At our expense ..and what I consider their error... we had to schedule a SECOND community budget meeting with ANOTHER $200 for hall rental and Cedar’s  expensive mailing cost ( I believe it is $1 a page ) to all in the community again.  They supposedly fixed the budget , we were to review it with the new numbers.  NOTE: Our property manager said A BUDGET IS AUTOMATICALLY RATIFIED WITHOUT A QUORUM as long as the board approved it. That is concerning since our HOA board missed  major errors the first time around but thankfully the homeowners caught them . A budget begins with precise bookkeeping which Cedar is responsible for and it is difficult to interpret a budget without it. Problems still are not resolved.

Cedar is not particularly polite when you have a problem with them and they have to deal with you .Cedar hasn’t answered my calls. My neighbors complained that they seem to have problems keeping track of HOA dues they have paid.
owner_answer:
Diane- We are sorry to hear about your concerns. The budget that is prepared for each association is approved by the Board of Directors before it is presented to the community. While we assist in preparing the budget, the Board of Directors is responsible for what goes into the budget and how it is presented.

We are also sorry to hear about your concerns with customer service. We record phone calls with our customer service department. If you can provide us with more detailed information, we will be happy to investigate this for you. Someone from our management team will be reaching out to you soon to discuss your concerns.

review_text: The service provided to homeowners by this company is horrendous.  Their customer service line cannot assist with issues and their answer is always that they will research and call you back.  I've never once received a call back. If I could give them less than one star I would.
owner_answer: Ronan, we are sorry to hear about your experience. We have researched our records and have no history of communication with a "Ronan Lynch." Please send an email to help@mycmg.com with your association name and contact information. We will be happy to call you to resolve any issues you might be having.

review_text:
Cedar Management is not Professional or businesslike when it comes to their customers, and homeowners. I have been trying for months to handle a dispute over late fees, unfairly placed on my account. After emails and phone calls, no justice!!
They keep saying they will let our board know, but yet not one phone call, letter, or email from the board. I am holding both accountable. It is obvious tbey do not believe in communicating with the homeowner. Silence is a big sign of GUILT! The board had a private meeting to change when a payment will be considered late. They didn't notify the homeowners after making a change. Our coupon still read "late fees accessed after the 30th of the month. The board then placed late fees on my account in September. The clincher is, I asked them to be removed off my account due to the unfair way it was done (sneaky way). And going forward I would pay by the 15th. Cedar Management  keep accruing late fees for the late fee each month. A late fee that I really do not owe!! The board sent out a letter dated November 7th 2018 notifying us of the new change. But late fees were put on my account 2 months before.?? I am so upset with the way I have been ignored!! Some service!!
If they can make a change to the late payment date once, and not notify homeowners of the change, it can happen again!! They need to do the Right Thing!!
owner_answer: Hi Lisa- We are sorry to hear about your frustrations. The board of directors for your community has instructed us to NOT waive any late fees. Therefore we cannot do so without authorization from them. We have notified your manager of your concerns and will forward it to the board for them to review to follow-up on this for you.

review_text: In the two years that my condo has used Cedar, I have always received excellent service. One of our board members lives in the unit next door to me, and she has also spoken very highly of our property manager. They seem like a good fit for our association.
owner_answer: Thank you so much for the incredible review, Sarah! Our mission is to continually improve our process and raise the bar in HOA Management to a level unprecedented in the industry. It's so encouraging to hear experiences of our team pursuing this well!

review_text: Virginia McCall is the best!
owner_answer: Thank you for the 5-star review, Joel! We've shared your encouraging words with Virginia too!

review_text: Great customer service!!  Kris M is fabulous and take pride in a job well done!!  Highly recommend as a property management group.  Much better experience than other groups I've had to deal with.
owner_answer: Thanks Sandee!  I really appreciate the kinds words.  Kris is an excellent member of our staff and has take extra care of our valued clients.  Thanks for sharing your thoughts about our service and company.

review_text: Greg is a wonderful help!
owner_answer: Aw! Thank you, Shaquaya! It's an honor to serve! We'll definitely be forwarding your kind words to Greg as well!

review_text: I can’t stress how much Cedar has helped us in vendor management. We have a very large community with a ton of amenities and without the help of our community manager Kris it would be way too much work for our board to handle. I want to express my gratitude towards Cedar for keeping our community beautiful.
owner_answer: Thank you for sharing and we will pass along your comments to Kris and our team.

review_text:
They took over management of Badin Shores. I paid my 2018 dues in full December 2017. They have sent me a notice of payment due for July, Aug, and Sept. I have spoken with someone who told me it takes 24 to 48 hours for them to respond. I have also emailed proof of payment and it has been over 48 hours and I have had no communication from anyone at Cedar Management. Today I sent the records certified. I am upset that I would have to jump through these hoops. Anyone else had issue where they try an get money when none is owed?
I just spoke with Jonathan who was a tremendous help and put me at ease that my dues for the balance of the 2018 year have not been lost. Thank you Jonathan for reaching out to me!
owner_answer: Melinda -  A response was sent on Monday, June 11 and again on Tuesday, June 12. We will follow up with you today to ensure you have the information needed. Thank you.

review_text: I've had a tremendously amazing experience helping our community transition over to Cedar as our management company. It was super smooth!
I have enjoyed working alongside Cedar in setting up their new facilities and hope to continue to see them grow and serve people well.
owner_answer: Sam - thank you for your 5 star review, we appreciate your feedback on our customer service.

review_text: Our manager Kris is a genuinely nice person and very easy to deal with. Our board has had excellent communication with her and she has helped with so many aspects in our community. Thanks Kris!
owner_answer: Jake - Thanks for the feedback, we appreciate your sharing.  We will also provide this feedback to Kris.

review_text: Casey Joye and Cedar Management are awesome!
owner_answer: Thank you for the encouragement, Autumn! We think our clients are awesome! We'll share your kind words with Casey as well!

review_text: Susan at Cedar is wonderful to work with.
owner_answer: Thank you Scott.  We appreciate your feedback and will let Susan know. Please let us know if we can ever be of assistance.

review_text: Was able to get my fence approved super quick after sending in my ARC form. Was notified a few weeks later via email. The last management company I had to chase them down with a thousand follow ups. Thanks Cedar!
owner_answer: Thank you Katherine for your feedback.

review_text: Cedar Management Group just started managing my community a few months ago and so far we have been very pleased with them. Our old management company was hard to reach but Cedar has polite staff and always returns our calls quickly. SO glad our community finally switched to them.
owner_answer: Thanks for your positive feedback.  We appreciate your providing your update regarding our service.  We look forward to working with you and the community in the future.

review_text:
Cedar Management has managed my neighborhood for 4 years.  In that time, the neighborhood has done a 180 - everyone is taking care and pride in their homes again AND they are paying their HOA fees on time.  Cedar has helped us save a lot of money in various ways - with getting better service than we ever have with other companies.
I highly recommend them
owner_answer: Bill, we appreciate your feedback and will continue to work hard on behalf of your community.

review_text: I am a current board member (Vice President) on a community managed by Cedar. Sandra, our current manager, does an excellent job of organizing our meetings and allowing for things to run smoothly. Cedar also does a great job of making sure we are in compliance of all HOA laws.
owner_answer: Thank you Roxanna for all your hard work.  We appreciate what you do for the community and will share your comments with our staff.

review_text: I was able to get my ARC request handled perfectly. I was very on edge about it taking forever, but Cedar and the board in my community were very helpful. Glad we have a management company that cares.
owner_answer: Thank you Richard.

review_text: My experience with Tracy yesterday was great. She was very prompt and provided me with the help I needed. Cedar has a respectful and dedicated staff.
owner_answer: Thank you for your comments.  We will share with Tracy and our staff.

review_text: You can’t ask for a more knowledgeable and professional person to work with than Casey Joye. A++
owner_answer: Thank you for the A++ review, Robin! We always try to ensure that the homeowners we serve get the best service possible. We'll share your kind words with Casey as well!

review_text: Casey Joye is Wonderful!!
owner_answer: Wonderful! Thank you, Kevin, for the review! We've shared your encouragement with Casey too!

review_text: I'm stunned by the five-star reviews of CMG.  I've been trying for months to have them repair the concrete on my porch that they tore up and 'fixed'.  At this point I'd be happy to for someone from CMG to simply acknowledge my issue.  After many, many phone calls & emails I've yet to talk to someone that can help.  They are unwilling to share contact details  of anyone in the organization when I do actually get through on the phone and all my emails have gone unanswered.
owner_answer: Robert - We have checked our records regarding your account and we have answered all calls and emails.  We have tried to provide the best information regarding your situation.  We will reach out to you again tomorrow and do our best to review all the information shared to ensure you understand the position of the community regarding your situation.  You are always welcome to contact us via email at help@mycmg.com and we will be more than happy to respond to you as we have in the past and assist in anyway that we can.

review_text: Cedar Management has worked with our community for almost three years.  As a member on the landscaping committee and now a Board Member for two years I have been extremely impressed with the level of attention and follow up the entire staff has provided our Board, Committe Members and Owners.   Our community has worked extremely hard to improve the overall look and feel of our enterance and our small amenities.   Cedar has helped us by work to reduce cost in other areas so we could achieve these goals without having to increase our assessments.   I appreciate the detailed reports and that they are provided to us timely each month.  I like that all of the accounting work by the company is handled by staff members and not outsourced to other companies or third parties.   They use a local bank and have worked with us to find better rates for our reserves money.   Finally the proactive communication and follow provided by our manager has been excellent.  I recommend that those who might consider a new management company, consider Cedar Management.  We have been very pleased and are happy to provide this feedback to the company and those who may read our comments.
owner_answer: Nathan - We do appreciate you sharing your feedback with us.  We continue to work hard to improve service, follow up and on-going support to our clients.  We will be sure to share these comments with our staff.

review_text: Recently closed on my home in Concord, and Cedar was able to get everything handled in less than 4 hours and over to my attorney which was amazing and such a relief. Thank you Cedar for helping me out!

A $10 convenience fee for paying your dues ONLINE. This is not even close to a reasonable amount.

A reasonable fee, like cities charge, for transaction processing is between $1.25 and $2.95. This completely covers the cost of a typical $100 quarterly fee paid online. 3% is a normal nominal charge. Change your usury policies Cedar. Ten percent is completely abnormal. No justification.

Convenience fees are not a profit center. At ten dollars per home per quarter that equates to tens of thousands in unearned income for the convenience of not having to mail a check. Other management firms have credit card, debit card, ACH and other electronic processing means for a lot less.

I think your HOA agreement should be discontinued for obstructing the ability to pay using modern methods.
Kala O’Connor helped us out and was very professional with all our questions!
owner_answer: Thank you for sharing your positive experience, Jonathan! Answering questions is one of our favorite things to do! We've shared your encouraging words with Kala as well!

review_text: We had some issues getting our key card to work. Took two years but we finally have a new one!
owner_answer: Melissa, we are glad that you have a key card that works.  Please do not hesitate to reach out to us at pool@mycmg.com with any future pool related concerns. Thank you

review_text: I've loved working with these guys! Makes my position as Board President less stressful, I can finally relax at night! Haha. They have been responsive and helpful, not to mention they are friendly and easy to work with! After having worked with a handful of terrible HOA management companies in the past, I am more than thankful to have found these guys!
owner_answer: Brian - Thanks for your feedback.  We appreciate you sharing and will take this back to share with our team.  We look forward to working with you and the community in the future.

review_text: Cedar is very difficult to get answers from, only giving them a 2nd star due to the pleasant experience I had from FINALLY being able to speak with a manager, if not for him they would have for sure gotten 1 star from me. Over 4 months of trying to get the same issue resolved and it still isn't even fixed. The call takers that answer the office phone do not follow through with requests (such as copying me on emails or following up) and refused to even let me leave a voicemail on a mangers office phone stating "it was against policy". The experiences I have had contacting them are ones you would not expect from a "management company". They did not act concerned, were dismissive of the problem at hand, and refused to take accountability for their lapses in service.
They don’t even deserve this. Most disgraceful non compassionate lazy HOA I’ve dealt with.
owner_answer: Jessica are sorry to see you leave remarks like this. We understand you are upset about the late fees on your account from the unpaid assessments. We will have a manager reach out to you to discuss these concerns.

review_text: Sam has done a great job for us in Trinity Crest!
owner_answer: Thank you Brent! We appreciate your feedback and will let Sam and our team know. Please let us know if we can ever be of assistance in the future.

review_text: Very reliable and professional. Helped us straighten out our budget for 2017, they've really put our community in a good place moving forward.  Thanks!

I am a Board member of an Association in Charlotte NC and Cedar was the management company in place when I joined the board.  I understand how things work in property management as 10 years ago I used to work for a property management company as a property manager. Therefore, their side stepping questions did not work with me.  Once I started digging into things with my fellow Board members we found tons of errors.  They paid other associations bills with our funds, even paid a homeowners personal bill with our funds just because the bill came in the mail to them - no approval obtained, overcharged late fees (which by their contract they get 50% of).  Once pointing out these errors and having to follow up constantly to get our funds back they kept getting more and more hostile for us simply saying "hey what happened here and we need to get reimbursed for this error".  We tried to be as cooperative as possible knowing that mistakes happen.  Our position was lets correct the issues and move forward.  We were having so much trouble with our property manager once we started pointing out the errors that we requested a meeting with their President, Paul.  It took 3 months to get a response to our request for a meeting.  We finally met with Paul and it was easy to see where the culture of arrogance comes from.  They dodged and side stepped addressing the fact of all their undeniable errors and instead focused on telling us how much time we were costing them each month.  Not giving any sympathy for the time their errors were costing us and we don't get paid for our time - they do! We were pretty much self managing because we couldn't get any real help from our property manager for the last several months so really all they were doing was taking phone calls from homeowners (if the homeowners could ever get through their phone system and actually get a call back from a message) and receiving and depositing checks.  There is no way they were spending the amount of time they stated on our account.  And yes I will say as a Board could we have been a bit more organized and decisive at times but can't all Boards?  We are volunteers thus the need for a management company to guide us and advise us which our property manager Scott was 100% not doing.  If he had managed us correctly we would not have been all over the place trying to resolve the items ourselves.  We ultimately decided things were never going to change and are currently transitioning to a new management company.  We have 26 days left with Cedar and we can't wait to move on.  We thought their service was bad before we let them know we were not renewing out contract now it has just been ridiculous.  Beyond not answering our direct questions Scott is now trying to make things more difficult for us in any way he can....he would never go out of his way to help us but yet he goes out of his way to hurt us.  Very unprofessional and immature.  We have spoken to other local Board Members that also utilize Cedar in our area and found they have experienced the same problems...erroneous homeowner accounts, increased delinquency due to erroneous accounts, homeowners unable to get return phone calls or get through their phone system, Board requests not being completed timely if at all, arrogant attitude, side stepping questions and and best of all when confronted their standard of operations is to blame the board.  Do not recommend this company at all!
owner_answer: Please feel free to contact us at help@mycmg.com.  We will do all we can to address the concerns shared.  Thank you.

review_text: The Support team at Cedar is on top of their game. They have a dedicated staff to answering homeowner questions and concerns. The last management company our HOA was with, you would be lucky to get a call back within a wee. It's nice to  know I can speak to a real person when I call
owner_answer: Thank you Aracely.

review_text: THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE !!!! No one has any answers I have been dealing with this for over an year just to PAY MY OWN HOA FEES!!! I’ve called and emailed several times and nothing has happen. Maybe they will read this and decide to respond. AND NO IM NOT SENDING ANOTHER DAMN EMAIL
owner_answer: Hi Daija- We're sorry to hear that you have had issues with paying your HOA fees. We do not have any records in our database matching your name. Please send us the name of your association and the person's name that owns the home, and we'll have happy to have someone give you a call.

review_text: They have a nice staff. The annual HOA fees are a bit much. There are many homes in Rogers Mill, they do too little for as much as they get every year. But I have never had to pay HOA fees before.
owner_answer: Thank you for the compliments Lawrence! We appreciate it. We understand your concerns about the HOA fees. These fees are set by the Board of Directors for your homeowners association to pay for expenses of the association. If you have concerns about the budget or the activity of the association, we encourage your participation. The association has an annual meeting every year to discuss the business affairs of the community. We will send out letters in advance of the meeting date to all homeowners. We encourage you to attend the meeting to learn more about the association and to discuss any concerns you might have with your board.

review_text: Cedar has handled closings in our community with ease. Our last management company couldn't even stay organized with such a simple task. Super glad we hired Cedar.
owner_answer: John, thanks for sharing your feedback.

review_text: Vernon has worked magnificently in providing our vendors the information they needed to keep our neighborhood kept up. It's nice to see our HOA dues going to something we can actually see.
owner_answer: Thank you Kimberli.  We appreciate your feedback,  we will share this with Vernon and our staff.

review_text:
I called and left a message for Joseph Dailey, our new Property Manager with Cedar Management Group, on July 5th to see if there had been any decisions made about our back yards (My yard is completely mud with no grass nor mulch at all.) and also other concerns.  I have yet to hear from him since July 5th.

Our neighborhood, Prosperity Place, has received terrible service from our previous management company and Property Manager, but our Board assured me this would not take place with Cedar Management.  Three weeks is not an acceptable time frame for a Property Manager to have no contact in response to concerns submitted to him.

I am thoroughly disappointed in the lack of service from Cedar Management, and considering they just started to manage our community on July 1st, 2018, I would think they would be more proactive with their response time.
owner_answer:
Ms. Blum-
We have received your responses and Joseph has been working directly with your Board of Directors. The Board of Directors has advised us not to speak with you regarding these issues. We will continue to work with the Board. You will receive further written information from the association regarding these matters shortly.

Please rest assured we are working very closely with the Board of Directors. Joseph is maintaining proactive and open communication with them to address issues within the community.

review_text: Thank you, Allison, for all of your help no matter what!
owner_answer: No matter what! It is our pleasure to serve! Thank you, A. Syler, for the 5-star review! We'll share your kind words with Allison as well!

review_text: Very professional and reliable staff! Brian, our community manager has been a great guy to work with. One of the more proactive companies I know!

I have thoroughly enjoyed working with my Property Manager, Errol Thomas and the rest of Cedar's staff. They have provided me with excellent service and have always worked diligently in resolving my concerns. Thank you so much Cedar Management Group!

I have had this company manage my properties for many years. When they do send a contractor out they do excellent work. HOWEVER, be prepared to leave at least 5 messages with the girls who answer the phone. They are always extremely pleasant by the way but that’s because they are always someone new (high turnover!). Also, when you email be prepared to wait over two weeks for a response. It is impossible to speak directly to anyone who knows anything at all! Another thing to be prepared for is to have your monthly drafted payments constantly refunded to your account and then they charge you exorbitant late fees because you are late on your payments. If you are looking for a property management company take heed. You’ve been warned by me and by the other reviewers here.
owner_answer: Mrs. Mewoski- We searched our records and could not find any clients with your name. In your comments, you stated that we manage your properties. We do not manage individual properties. We only manage community associations. It appears that you may have us confused with another company. If you are still having issues or need assistance, please contact us with your association's name and your property address. You can email us at help@mycmg.com and we'll see if we can verify your information.

review_text: This is a horrible company to manage your community.  They do not enforce any of the covenants in my neighborhood and when you call and ask them why there are so many people violating the rules and regulations the only response I have ever gotten was "take a picture and email it to us". That has never worked because they don't do their part on actually following up to send a warning or fine to the violator.  Big thanks to cedar management for helping my neighborhood loose value.  That's not a easy task for a management company when you have so many people in the community trying to make it right.  Stay away from this company if you are looking for an HOA.  It is a waste of your communities time and money.  Hopefully our neighborhood president will move on to another company who will actually do their job when you pay them.
owner_answer: Ryan - We value your feedback but know that the enforcement process varies by community.  We work extremely hard to help the Board and  committee enforcement process.  We encourage you to reach out to us at help@mycmg.com, as we are always here to help you and the community.

review_text: Thank you Allison for all your help with getting my account out of delinquent.
owner_answer: Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience, George! We'll ensure that Allison sees your kind words and if you have any further questions or concerns, it'd be our pleasure to assist you!

review_text: Gregory was a big help!
owner_answer: Thank you for your review! Our mission is to have the best trained professional staff available to our homeowners so it is very encouraging to hear your experience! Thank you!

review_text: Casey Joye is amazing
owner_answer: Thank you for your 5-star review! Our mission is to have the best trained professional staff available! Your words are so encouraging to see!

review_text: Cedar has been nothing but professional since taking over as the management company for our small HOA in Gastonia. On time letters and notices and a super friendly staff.
Erin Lewis was a pleasure to deal with, very friendly and knew exactly what to do to help me out! Thanks Erin!
owner_answer: Thank you, Heather, for the 5-star review. Our mission is to continually improve our process and raise the bar in HOA Management to a level unprecedented in the industry. It's so encouraging to hear experiences of our team pursuing this well!

review_text: This HOA is a joke.  They allow people on the board to harass people while nit picking over small details while letting gross violations seem to go unresolved.  I have been at my property for 20 years and had a shed on the side of my house.  It goes up against the house and I was told by an board member in the neighborhood about 12 years ago that as long as i paint it to match the house everything is fine,  now today out of nowhere they tell me that it's a problem.... They told me that I can not run a business from the house because i customize my rides,  even though a guy from mecklenburg zoning told me in 2005 that as long as the cars belong to me I can do whatever I want. I have been told by many strangers how nice my house looks but it seems that some jealous neighbors that choose not to invest time or money into their homes want to cause problems for me and the HOA threatens to fine for every issue brought by board members. You simply pay the association to bully you.  Before you move into a neighborhood avoid moving in if these guys are over you.
owner_answer: Dez- We are sorry to hear about your frustrations with your community. If you require assistance, please contact us at help@mycmg.com with your association name and property address so that we can assist you. Your association is ran by a Board of Directors in your community. If you are unhappy with how your association is being governed, we encourage you to get involved run for the board so you can help.

review_text:
This by far has been the worst Management group I have ever dealt with. We moved into our new home about a year & 1/2 ago, and have been trying to get a simple pool pass since then. This group keeps giving us the run around, saying they have already issued a pass to the house. So basically they are saying if you buy from someone in the neighborhood you'll need to pay $25 to get access to the pool!

Its these little things that separate the good companies from the bad. This company isn't even working with us to remedy the situation. Email after email keeps getting pushed off or they are requesting we pay for "another" pass. This is all over a pool pass!! I can only imagine if I had to deal with a real issue. This company lack of simple customer service is beyond anything I have ever seen.

Do yourself a favor and never hire this company.
owner_answer: Thank you for your feedback. However,  the Board of Directors of your community made the decision to issue pool passes to the property itself and charge a new pass fee should the seller not give the pass to the new owner. As the management firm hired by the Board, we merely act upon their decisions at their direction and did not make this policy. Please contact our office directly if you would like to discuss this matter further.

review_text:
Stay away from this company if you are a HOA seeking a management company!  They have a termination fee of around $3000 hidden in their contracts that HOA's have to pay them when they figure out how incompetent Cedar service and management is.  Our HOA had to pay the fee to Cedar even after the year long contract had expired.  The way they have it written in the contract, they get their fee when their services are terminated no matter what.  It will be interesting to see how the company responds to this FACT-will anxiously await Cedar's response to this nugget of info.

UPDATE:  I am shocked that anyone from Cedar actually tried to say that my post was erroneous.  Well "Owner"-how do you explain the fee that our HOA was assessed upon cancellation of your services when: 1)we didn't terminate your services until well past the one year contract (approximately 18 months) and 2) we gave the allotted  30/60/or 90 day notice (I can't remember which was required per the contract)?  Heed my advice and stay away from this company if you can!
owner_answer:
We are sorry to hear you feel this way. The statement that we have a $3000 termination fee is completely false. We do charge early termination fees if a proper notice of termination is not given. This is a standard business practice in any industry.

There are no hidden fees in our contract. All fees are outlined in detail and also reviewed with the board prior to signing an agreement. The entire length of the contract is less than four pages. We also take time to review the agreement with the board so they have time to review and ask questions prior to signing.

Your statement is misleading and is not representative of who we are as an Accredited Association Management Company. We strongly hope that you will consider removing your review for false information. Please contact us at help@mycmg.com if you have questions or would like to discuss further.

review_text: Greg was very knowledgeable and helpful.
owner_answer: Wonderful! Thank you for sharing the details of your experience, Sandra. We'll make sure Greg sees your kind words as well!

review_text: Community support has been tremendously helpful since me and my husband moved into our Huntersville community. They are always available via phone or email and helped us with payment forms and ARC requests. Very grateful we moved into an easy to deal with HOA.
owner_answer: Roger thanks for sharing.

review_text: Since Cedar has taken over our community the grass has transformed back to lush green and a has been very appealing. I have lived in a few HOA neighborhoods and so far my experience has been exceptional.
owner_answer: Lance - Thank you for the feedback.  We appreciate you sharing.

review_text: Cedar Management Group (CMG) does its best to provide a service to homeowners on behalf of the HOA Board of Directors. The staff of CMG is committed to customer service. Samantha Rickman was especially helpful in answering my questions.
owner_answer: Thank you for the feedback! We will let Samantha and her team know. Please let us know if we can ever of assistance.

review_text: Casey Joye is awesome
owner_answer: Thank you for the 5-star review, Hannah! We've shared your kind words with Casey too!

review_text: If you're looking for an honest HOA company that won't give you the run-around, go to Cedar. Julie drove a good distance to meet with our board and answer any questions we had with the contract and coming on board. Other HOA management companies I couldn't even get a call back.
owner_answer: Thank you for the feedback Anna.  We appreciate you sharing.

review_text: As a board member I can say this is the WORST management company in Charlotte, and we've used many. Look at how they respond to critical reviews on here. They post confidential financial information on others accounts. If you are a board member considering hiring this company - RUN AWAY.
owner_answer:
Steve-

We're sorry to hear about your concerns. We do not post any confidential information on Google. If you have concerns that need to be addressed, please contact us so that we can have your property manager or one of their supervisors help you resolve them.

Update:
Steve, our IT team has performed an exhaustive query and cannot locate any records with your information in our associations. We searched for Steve, Steven, and Stephen and did not find any records with Steve Wallace. If you feel this is a mistake, please email us at help@mycmg.com with your contact information and we'll be happy to review this with you further.

review_text: The whole community support team was efficient with helping me resolve the past due balance I had. Extremely polite and relieved a lot of stress for me and my family.
owner_answer: Eric, we appreciate your feedback and are happy to hear about your positive experience with our team.  We will share your comments with them.

review_text: Absolutely terrible communication and follow-through of service requests. I’ve had multiple issues with my home in the past year and even after I’ve made repeated attempts to follow up by email and phone calls, they have failed to resolve our issues.
owner_answer: Rob - While we appreciate your opinion we have worked with you (based on our records) to address concerns where the association is responsible for repair and maintenance.  We will reach out to you again to review this information and help as we can regarding issues where the association is responsible for the service request provided to us.  Thank you.

review_text: What a horrible company.  They manage the condos at the site that I rent out.  They charge almost as much money for management fees as my mortgage.  They charge outrageous and unverified fines that are not even recieved by the renter before they levy the fine!  When I called the office they had the wrong articles of infractions in the letters of the fine and they still charged us for them.  They take pictures on your property and one of the occupants of my property was downstairs nude!  These reviews are obviously written by employees.  The pool is closed all summer.  The community was shot up last year and no new security policies were put into place.  That is why I moved.  So if this is the company you want to represent you or manage you property, be my guest.
owner_answer: Marquis-We don't set the amount of monthly dues that are charged by your association.   Our job is assist the board in meeting its obligations both short and long term.  We have looked into your account and see no pictures that were taken at your property (as all of these are documented in our system).  Feel free to contact our office directly to review the situation and issue.

review_text: Greg is awesome!
owner_answer: Thank you for your kind words and generous review! We'll ensure that Greg sees!

review_text: My pool pass is not work I call and I was told to send an email which I did. It's been twos days now and everytime I call I get the same answer that they are working on emails. My problem is if I don't pay my HOA fees I get a late fees or they are ready to take you to court, I pay my fees on time so I see no reason for them to deactivate my pool pass. So I guess I am paying for service for nothing.
owner_answer: Sharon, we're sorry to hear about this experience. There could be different reasons for your pass not working. If payments are late, the homeowners association can revoke pool privileges for past due balances. If your account is current and your pool pass is not working, there could be an issue with the system. Please send an email to help@mycmg.com with your association name and property address so that we can look into this for you right away.

review_text: I would give this company negative stars if I could. They have no understanding of customer service or professional communication. My community has had numerous problems with them from lack of enforcing HOA bylaws to being flat out disrespectful and not doing their job.
owner_answer: Kam - Sorry you have this opinion, please know your concerns.   We are here to assist and help you and the community.  Share with us at help@mycmg.com.  We will do all we can to address with your Board of Directors.

review_text: Susan is a pleasure to work with.
owner_answer: Thank you Jack. We will certainly let Susan and her team know. Please let us know if we can ever be of assistance.

review_text: this management company sucks! extremely unprofessional front desk folks and the monthly newsletter we get for our subdivision is full of grammatical errors.
owner_answer:
Emanuel-
We ask that you remove or consider updating your review. You state that we never answer the phone or your emails. We received an email from you on Sunday April 28th at 8:49PM about your concerns regarding street parking. We replied to that email on Monday April 29th.

In the email you sent to us Sunday evening, you stated:

Hello, we just received the newsletter on our door and we have some concerns. We would like to know what the 'safety concerns' are in regards to street parking?

The newsletter that was on your door was not sent by our office. This was done by your board of directors. Our company does not put letters on homeowner's doors. All communication is emailed or mailed and we keep electronic logs of ALL communication we send to homeowners.

If you have additional concerns you would like to discuss, please contact us at help@mycmg.com. In the meantime, we ask that you consider removing or updating this review because of the misunderstanding. We appreciate your time and attention to this request.

review_text: horrible.  make sure you look at your bank statements as their system is a mess.
owner_answer:
Karen-
We are sorry to see you have left us a negative review. If you can provide more insight to your concerns, we will be happy to assist you. Please email us at help@mycmg.com with your association name and property address and we'll be happy to assist you.

review_text: My experience with agency is not good.  They are the agency my neighborhood uses.  I'm not sure if it's the agency or the board members but since we moved over to them, the neighborhood looks horrible.  I have called several times to get resolve for some issues in the neighborhood, no follow - up call, email or physical mail.  However;  I did receive a notice that my bill was past due.  I have resolved that but no other communication.  Each time I call I'm told they do not handle these issues but the board does.  So now I need to find out who to file my concerns with on the board because between the 2 of them someone is dropping the ball and not doing their job.
owner_answer: Please contact our office at help@mycmg.com.  We will do all we can to assist you.

review_text: Allison rocks!  That is all.
owner_answer: Thank you for the 5-star review! We'll be sure to share your kind words with Allison as well! That is all. ??

review_text:
First off, I am not a competitor trying to bad mouth Cedar.  I am simply a homeowner that paid his dues online and could not get a response in regards to whether or not my pool pass would be activated in time for the weekend.  I got a response to my email asking the question but the answer did not answer the question at all.  They simply stated that I still had a balance.  What?  I included my confirmation number in the email but apparently they skipped over that.  Ended up having to leave a message with their call center, stated verbatim what  was in my email and got a call back from them saying that they never received my email and that I still had a balance. Finally found out that I had a $20 late fee that I did not pay since the website does not have the capability of showing you your current balance.  Why they charge $12.95 for the website payment is beyond my understanding.  For that service charge you should be able to view your account.

With all that said, as far as management companies are concerned, communication is a major issue.  They also lack the ability to enforce any HOA rule.  Our neighborhood has a bad parking problem and Cedar has yet to actually enforce any of their towing threats.  They seem more concerned about shutter paint.  They get an A++ for being able to collect money though, seems that's the only thing they're concerned about.

Finally, this is for the lady I spoke with today on the phone who said that I would not be able to leave a review online.  Do you like apples?

Having had other management companies in the past, I am continually impressed with the entire team at Cedar Management Group.  Our pool opening has gone as smooth as it can and in the few instances of problems, everyone I needed at Cedar was ready, willing and able to help.  I would recommend Cedar to anyone needing their services.
The beginning of tax season is always a dread for me (Board President) and our association, but Cedar was able to guide us and help alleviate the process. Very thankful

review_text: Read all the post and chose a different HOA!! Fees on top of fees!!

Madelaine-

We understand you are upset about being sent to an attorney's office for unpaid dues. Please understand that we keep communication logs of all homeowner inquiries and our records show that we have made several communication attempts with you about your dues AND you called our offices inquiring about your dues back in March.

On 1-16-19 we sent a welcome letter that had instructions for how to pay your dues and access your account information through our portal.
On 2-28-19 we sent the billing
On 3-14-19 you called our office inquiring why your HOA dues were $110
On 3-21-19 we sent a past due / demand notice
On 4-20-19 we sent another account statement

In addition to the communications that we sent, you also had access to your account 24/7 through our web portal (this will be restored once your account is settled). In the future, please do not ignore communications about your association and your HOA fees.

review_text: Seemingly this company is slowly taking over our community, and appointing their own board members,  and else eliminating existing board members. Sent emails to our community liaison qeeksagiw no response.

We are unable to comment further about your specific community for privacy reasons. However, please contact us at help@mycmg.com and we will be happy to assist you.

review_text: Living in an HOA managed by Cedar has done wonders for our community. In previous years we have had mountains of issues with pool fobs, vendor invoicing, and getting in touch with our property manager. Communication has been very pleasant thus far.

Our community is managed by Cedar. We moved here from out of town about 4 years. At the time, the association was managed by another company. Cedar took over in 2016 and they have helped us clean up issues with our pool, our entrance, broken street lights, and several other things in the short amount of time working with us. Thank you!

I have been a homeowner in Michael's Landing for 9-10 years and I am thoroughly surprised by some of the rave reviews as well.  As the management group, the generic answer of "we will create a ticket" or "we will contact your community manager" is always the response.  A special assessment has been assessed in our HOA dues as long as I've lived there.  The board members and the beyond tacky delivery of the HOA meetings are a sight to witness.  In my last request for a pothole to be fixed was sent in well over 9 months ago.  Of course the generic response was provided. Yet, when CMG needs payment or anything else, they send very detailed, yet threatening documentation stating that you have 15 days to comply.  However to get anything fixed or addressed, it takes 15 months or longer because the board has to send out feelers for quotes and see if they will approve the request.  Very tacky operation.  I wish the few homeowners of Michael's Landing would take a stand. If this is truly an effective management group, then act accordingly. Especially since the board members are required to be homeowners, but most of them own multiple properties to rent out or don't live on the property themselves. This shows how they value the community because they hardly see the problems since they DON'T live there; but they own, so they can get away with it.
owner_answer: Dee - We are always here to assist and help you.  Checking our records we have responded to all calls and emails from you and show no pending or open items with your property.   We will share you feedback with the Board.  We are here to help, contact us at help@mycmg.com.

review_text: The positive reviews are most likely written by owners and staff.  This company is incredibly unprofessional, unreliable, and lacks basic common sense.  If you are a home owners association board member or president, I would strongly encourage you to look elsewhere.  You can hire an alternative company that provides more services for a fraction of the cost of what Cedar charges.

review_text: I would like to thank Cedar for their extensive help on my community's budget. We were able to reduce our cost's by 10% which enabled us to increase the landscaping budget and create an overall better looking community.
