review_text:
A bad management company like Cedar Management can ruin a whole community. I have lived in many neighborhoods and have experiences with many HOA's but Cedar Management is the worst! And that opinion has already been formed after 7 months in the community. I have written letters, emailed numerous times, talked to the board, talked to the personal rep for my community, and have continued to follow up for the last 7 months to get a pool pass / fob. They have blown me off for 7 months, now the pool is going to open very soon. A pass was NOT provided at closing. I have paid all of the dues INCLUDING the hidden fee of $395 that is costs to move into this run down community. This fee was not disclosed until the day before closing!!!! Talk about UNETHICAL! The community is going downhill fast with broken fences that need cleaned, lack of landscaping maintenance, pot holes, let alone the lack of follow through with homeowners who do not maintain their properties. The list of homes that are in violation is too long to report plus it would be a waste of time with no follow through. It is so embarrassing to tell people that I moved into Heritage Green that I tell them I am part of the other neighborhood attached. The community needs to take a stand and protect OUR PROPERTY VALUES before Cedar Management destroys them.
I want my pool pass ASAP without anymore lies about the printer being down. Also, I will be making plans to get the Hell out of this community and next time I buy I will make sure they don't have Cedar Management.
I understand this company only responds/acknowledges good feedback.  But you really do employees and clients a disservice  by not learning from your mistakes and the “people” know.
owner_answer: Please feel fee to contact us at help@mycmg.com.  We will do all we can to assist you.

review_text: This management company is useless. Every time I call them I get the answering service and never get a call back. When I have spoken to someone I'm rushed, they're very rude and act like I'm bothering them. I've reported several violations and they've done nothing. Their warning letters are an absolute joke and no one takes them seriously because Cedar never follows up. After 3 letters they supposed to have a hearing with the violator which I've yet to see happen. Our neighborhood looks like a ghetto. No one cuts their grass, they leave their trash cans out all week, our pool parking lot is a known drug spot and has been reported to the police AND Cedar several times and nothing has been done. People's siding on their houses are full of mold. There are broken down cars in driveways. What are we paying for as HOA members? To have grass cut and a small pool maintained 4 months out of the year? Our dues are not cheap and we don't even have nice landscaping at the front of the sub division as most all other neighborhoods do. I've seen other neighborhoods pay less and get so much more. They are supposed to be enforcing the covenant rules but do nothing. Stay far away from this company.
owner_answer: Steven - Thank you for your feedback. Our community support team works hard to call back every homeowner who leaves a message and would never rush someone off the phone. We have reviewed your account and it shows several calls have been returned to you, as well as reports of violations. The decision to issue violations is up to the board of directors, and hearings have be held over the past several months. If there are any specific homes you are referring to, we ask that you please contact our office directly so we can  send your reports to your board of directors. When contacting our office, a member of our support team would also  be more than happy to verify what your dues cover and discuss any other concerns you may have in a more in depth manner.

review_text: Nina Gibson is awesome
owner_answer: Thank you for the 5-stars, Leeann! We've shared your encouraging words with Nina too!

review_text: Moving into a new HOA, I thought would be stressful, but Cedar Management Group has made the transition easy.  The common areas have been kept up, and it's a relief to see things like this get handled promptly by the Board.
owner_answer: Thank you for the feedback Patty.

review_text:
I'm a resident dealing with Cedar Management Group.  I pay $192 per month in HOA fees and am completely baffled by the lack of urgency in any matters brought to their attention.  I contacted them on June 4th, 2018 about an exterior leak on my town home that was causing the water (during rainstorms) to get into my windows and leak down through my house into the 2nd floor (it's a 3 story town home) into my kitchen through the windows directly below the third floor windows.  At first, I was contacted saying to allow a vendor 2 weeks to contact me regarding repairs.  That would have put me at June 28th, 2018 where I could have at least expected to have a date set for repairs.  Today it is July 11, 2018 and I just received an email from the maintenance department asking for my phone number since they didn't have it on file (which they must have lost because i filled out paperwork regarding my vehicle, address, phone number, etc.).  I am completely dissatisfied with this company and will be bringing it to my boards attention at our next meeting on the Monday, July 16.  It is absolutely ridiculous that residents are required to pay $192 per month for it to take OVER A MONTH to even have someone call you about fixing an issue that could affect your home in many ways.  Since June 4th, it has rained several times and each time that water leaks into my home causes more damage.  If you're looking for a property management company DO NOT choose Cedar Management Group.  For what seems to be such a simple job of contacting a vendor/contractor to repair an exterior window leak, they can't even handle that.

Not to mention our community pool was closed last week and nobody received an email regarding the matter.  No communication whatsoever and are terrible at answering customer complaints.
owner_answer:
Ryan, we are very sorry to hear about this experience. We are following up with the maintenance department and the contractor about what happened. A work order was dispatched to an approved contractor and everything was approved to repaired. We will investigate this issue with the contractor to find out what has happened. We will also be calling you soon to rectify this situation. Thank you for bringing it to our attention.

Update: Ryan, upon further review of this situation, we were able to trace down what happened. The original request was received on June 4th and we notified The Board the same day. The Board requested an estimate before repairs were made and a quote request was sent immediately. We received the estimate back 4 business days later which was approved the same day. The contractor found what he believed was the source of the leak and made repairs. When it rained again, the leaks still happened. We have dispatched a contractor to make the necessary repairs and try to find the origin of the leak.

Exterior water leaks can be hard to trace down. Once a repair is made, we have to wait until more rainy weather to fully ensure the leak does not happen again.

review_text:
Cedar

Be very careful and do your research. I was shocked to see that they still have an A+ rating on the Better Business Bureau website, but as I now look deeper there are multiple locations for the same company. We’ve had our HOA managed by Cedar Management out of N. Carolina for 2yrs now and the only thing they’ve managed to do for our homeowners is almost bankrupt our HOA account by nickel and dimming us for everything.

During the initial meeting with the management representative and while preparing to switch over to Cedar Management from Prime Financial we were promised a whole variety of services. It almost sounded to good to be true. Everything from monthly inspection and enforcement of the bylaws & covenants, collections, legal representation, etc.  all for a monthly fee of $675. Then slowly the additional fees for administration, mailing, account maintenance, etc. started rolling in. Eventually we noticed our monthly management fees were up around $1,200 to $1,300 a month.

Cedar Management also has a standard $395 transfer fee charged to every new homeowner at closing. This fee is supposed to be for transferring the account into Cedars HOA database, providing a welcome packet with HOA Bylaws & Covenants, and ensuring there’s no past fines on the dead. The HOA never sees any of this money, most homeowners complained of never receiving the covenants, and home owners accounts are far from up to date with any type of accuracy.

During our time managed by Cedar our HOA Green Space taxes were left unpaid for two years to where they were threatened to go up for auction by the city of Sumter. Then when paid after multiple board members had to get  involved they had hefty late fees, all of which Cedar gladly paid out of the HOA account trying to take no accountability.

While digging into the 75 scanned pages of mess they email monthly we noticed every bill was always paid late and had incurred late fees. That just seemed to be standard operating procedure for them. All at the Homeowners Association expense.

The drive through inspections for violation were never scheduled and very sporadic and by the time the letters went out 3 weeks later the 10 day notice to cut the lawn was no good and unenforceable. Cedar never really tracked the violations for enforcement or fines anyways. So tenants would receive the same violation month after month all with an expected completion date never resulting in a fine.

Then when the neighborhood continually started to look worse and worse due to constant unenforceable violation letters and the HOA board discussed taking a few accounts to court for collections, we were told oh no we actually don’t have lawyers for the HOA they’re only to protect Cedar. Causing the HOA board to once again do all of the leg work that we thought we were paying for.

In the past two years the HOA Board has continually asked for many issues to be corrected to continually find out that our representative at Cedar has quit and we’re being assigned a new rep, then the new representative claims no knowledge of any complaints or issues starting the entire process over again. It’s like a black hole.

I will be so glad to see 1 August 2018, when we no longer have to deal with this company and can finally start getting our Homeowners Association back to where it should be.
owner_answer:
Thank you for your comments, one of our staff members will reach out to you to discuss these concerns.  We provide our boards with a detailed and comprehensive financial report each month.  Any additional fees charged were disclosed in our management agreement and were read by the board prior to signing.  Additionally, we provide new homeowners with information about their community and our website portal, where governing documents are always available to homeowners.

In regards to the collections and violations issues, we work with several attorney firms that can represent the association. If an account is delinquent, we can turn over the account to a law firm with board approval. The board does not have to do any "leg work" in these situations. In regards to the violations, we work directly with the board on how they want to address them. In order for fines to be processed, a hearing is required by law and the board is responsible for those hearings. If the board does not hold hearings, then we cannot assess a fine.

We are sorry to hear about your experience and we hope this helps address some of your concerns.

review_text: This group “manages” wher my mother lives at The Towns in Winston-Salem, they dont do anything. She had to wait 60 days to have a leaky roof fixed and the latest is waiting 30 days to have a dead bush cut down in the flower bed!! Its past the thirty days, the board hasn’t reviewed it, i told her i will cut it down myself. Another issue is the kids are not supposed to ride thier bikes on the sidewalk but they do and have scratched multiple places on her bumper and trunk hood, not rub off buff out scratches, deep down to the metal and plastic. She won’t call Cedar nor will she call the board lady in her neighborhood because she won’t do anything either,,,,until her car gets scratched probably! My sister-in-law worked as a propert manager fir years and said this group has many complaints. Very bad business yall.
owner_answer: Christy, we do work with the Board and specific vendors to quickly address concerns as they are provided to us.  We have reviewed the records of the community and all pending work orders have been completed. Please contact our office at help@mycmg.com, we will be more than happy to review the completed request and provide additional assistance as needed.  Thank you.

review_text: The handling of the pool fobs this year was excellent. There has always been issues with previous management companies losing them. Bravo to Cedar
owner_answer: Asher - Thank you for the feedback.  We appreciate your time and sharing with us.

review_text: Beware of Dirty Business. CEDAR MANAGEMENT is a Horrible Company. Customer Service is bad, unprofessional, and unreliable. It takes forever to get in touch with anyone.  I have tried contacting the President, numerous times but he seems to be out on his yacht.  DO NOT PAY BILLS On-LINE, they charge 15 dollars extra for the process if the process works. They don't tell you about that one in the little print.   We have tried 3 different times to set up bill pay before we found out they nickel and dime you.   If it works it may take hold for that month but the Bill Pay On-Line never works right. Even if you send it in the mail, they still classify it as late.  They don't send letters to stat you haven't paid until it's too late and you owe thousands of dollars, PLUS Court Costs. They will and Love to take you to COURT. They must be in together with certain law Firms to rip tax paying owners. God forbid you a have an issue with your property. They won't return your calls and basically, they don't care about you or your property.  It's a shame that we don't see where our HOA Fees go too. Our Condo Complex is in shambles while the CEO is on his yacht that we paid for.  Must be nice to Rip people off while cruising on Lake Norman.   Cedar Management has nothing good to offer any person or business. If you’re looking to do business with these shady characters Good Luck, but I would look to some other business.   Some other company who cares about the homeowners; and has ethical business values.  Cedar management DOES NOT HAVE A SOUL.

review_text: Nothing but great things to say about Cedar thus far. Our reserve funds are back to where they were before we got ourselves aligned with the wrong management company. Kudos.
owner_answer: Jennifer - Thank you for the comments.   We appreciate your feedback.

review_text: I wanted to thank Errol Thomas and the Maintenance Department for handling my emergency needs in a proficient manner.  You all are the best!

I see no reason for HOA's they dont address any issues only tell you to contact someone else.  I was a couple of days late on my HOA of 189.00  late payment cost me 450.00 in lawyer fees.  once paid they still did not bring account current so my family was unable to enjoy the pool pass, which i remind you is the only thing available that they control,

Exactly the payment was made to the law office Rogers Townsend & Thomas
3800 Arco Corporate Drive
Suite 250
Charlotte, NC 28273.
on June 15th 2018 in FULL  a total of 767.77 just because she was late on one HOA dues...as i said previously she never received any mail or certified letter stating to make arraignments or the 189.00 that was due would not have turned into 767.77.  My mother receives a monthly allotment and so please believe that making this 189.00 would have been.  Never has she had issues with paying her HOAs before until now.
owner_answer:
Hi Rashawnda- We're sorry to hear about the experience with your community. It is our job to help the Board of Directors and the homeowners maintain a high standard for the entire community. We do not send accounts to an attorney for being a few days late. We always send past due reminders to give an owner an opportunity to make payment arrangements. If we do not receive a response, the HOA's Board of Directors will advise us on how they want us to proceed with follow-up. If owners have a past due balance, the HOA can revoke the pool pass until the account is made current. Please email us at help@mycmg.com and include your association's name and your property address so we can help you discuss payment arrangements.

EDIT: Rashawnda, we have looked into your account and there are still issues with your account balance. Please contact our office to discuss this so we can help resolve the issues with this situation.

review_text: I am a homeowner in the Nevin Creek community which is managed by this company. This community is in DESPERATE need of maintenance. What was once bushes have now grown into trees. Some of the homes have weeds that have attached themselves to the windows on the property and have them almost completely covered. The grass is calf high in many areas which is potentially dangerous because of the problems we've had with snakes. Doors need to be painted because they have been faded by the sun. The whole complex looks rundown due to a lack of consistent maintenance. I'm trying to rent my townhome out and this has caused me to lose potential rentals. Please take pride in the upkeep of ALL of your properties regardless of the area they are in. I wish I could share pictures! UNACCEPTABLE!!
Greg is great!

review_text: I have multiple rental homes in the Glenridge community.  I tried to use Cedar Managements website to pay the HOA dues for each rental. review_text: First, this Company doesn't deserve a star but since I'm forced to add a rating in order to post so be it.  Cedar Management is the worst company ever!!! RUN from anything remotely associated with Cedar!  This so called management company has allowed our once beautiful community to reach a lamentable state!  Cedar Management is an absolute disgrace!

review_text: This company has been the best HOA management company my association has ever had. Seriously, I've had maintenance issues at 11pm and their team is always quick to respond. On top of that - they're friendly and actually seem to care. We've had a few different companies in the past... and I am really hoping that we don't switch again. At least at Cedar, I can get a hold of a live human being! Keep it up!

This company is a sad excuse for a management group. I have worked in property management for 4 years and have not seen a management company with such low standards and poor management skills until I moved into a property they manage (huge mistake). I complained to our property manager about the building fire alarms falsely going off 3 times within a few months, and her response was "You are now BANNED from communicating with Cedar Management Group and from speaking with anyone who works at the building." Her supervisor reached out to me after speaking with about 4 different Cedar representatives, who left me a voicemail saying "there is nothing we can do". I would highly suggest management take a good hard look at themselves and make some serious changes, you do not treat good paying tenants like that, ESPECIALLY when the landlords are paying a pretty penny in HOA fees - for nothing. I have never been treated so poorly before, this company is absolutely horrible and we cannot wait until our lease ends.

**UPDATE - In response to the owner: on the contrary, I actually called Cedar Management Group about 7 times spoke with several different people, and forwarded the voicemail left on my phone by Sandra Collins word for word telling us we are officially banned from contact Cedar Management Group and the on site property management staff. I also left her supervisor a voicemail about her "banning" us (which is neither legal nor ethical) which was never responded to - So yes, Cedar Management Company DOES indeed FORBID residents from contacting them if they have any complaints at all. In fact, I have even attached a screenshot of the email we received shortly after the rude voicemail telling us we are not to contact CMG.
owner_answer: Sarah,  Our staff has never banned someone from contacting our company.  If anything we encourage our owners to reach out to us so we can assist.  As a renter inside of an HOA, I would suggest you speak with your rental management company and or unit owner.  While we will do all we can to assist those who rent properties in our communities there are certain situations that require the owner and or rental management company involvement.   As always you are welcome to contact us at help@mycmg.com.

owner_answer: Thank you Rebekka - we appreciate your feedback and positive comments.

review_text: So far we have been very pleased with the level of service received from Cedar Management for our community. The communication has been top-notch and the level of responsiveness from our Community Manager has been fantastic.
My community manager has been very proactive in taking care of our community. Very impressed by the amount of professionalism within the company.

Apparently there was a late charge of $25.00 on my account from the previous management company which I had assumed was credited by them after we spoke.  When Cedar took over they never notified me that the late charge was still on there.  After, no telling how long, they cut off the pool card.  I sent an email to the board to ask for the late charge to be waived as I always pay on time.  They declined and so, in order for the tenant to have access to the pool, I paid the lousy $25.00 so the card could be reactivated.  To date, the card is still not activated.  Terrible customer service!!!
owner_answer: Jacki, sorry to hear of the issues you have had.  We don't have control over the late fees but in our records it appears the pool card was activated within 24 hours of the late charge being paid.  Please contact our office should your card not work.  Thank you.

review_text: The community support rep Marcie was so courteous and helpful assisting me so far with my issues. Very kind and pleasant to deal with on the phone.
owner_answer: Thank you for your feedback.

review_text: I just spoke with Maya, and once again Cedar management was quick, friendly and attentive to the needs of myself and my property.
owner_answer: Thank you for your feedback.

review_text:
Web site fails to take payments correctly. (Street is incorrect or property association is incorrect, really I cut and paste it from your form!)
No need to call for assistance, they are closed most of the time. And when it comes to advance notice on meeting, providing requested right of way information, homeowners are out of luck there too.  In short they are not customer friendly.

Cedar Management is the worst!!! I do not understand why you make so many people in a community pay HOA Dues when nothing and I mean absolutely nothing is being done in the neighborhood! Where is the money going! No one cares to explain that! The only communication you receive from these people are past due bills are violations! How about a notice with who is on the board for our community. How about a notice about a HOA meeting! How about a positive that is positive! There has been several house and car break ins! Kids just riding dirt bikes all through the neighborhood! Why  am I paying money to a place where they have nothing to show for these so called dues! Then you want to tell me how to maintience my property! How about you take some of my dues and take care of it! That just wouldn't be feasible now would it!
owner_answer: Sonya - We are sorry you have these opinions.  Each community has an annual meeting and all owners are notified prior to this meeting so they can make time to attend.  Many of these issues you have reviewed above are discussed at the annual meeting.  If you were unable to attend, feel free to reach out to us and we can provide you with more details about your community, Board and how we are working to resolve all owner concerns on a regular basis.  Our email is support@mycmg.com.  Thank you.

review_text: I've lived in other communities where the HOA was a nightmare. Cedar has been prompt and easy to deal with thus far but the jury is still out on that. I had a complaint about a neighbor that had loud music on late at night and they seemed to have taken care of that issue. I will continue to monitor the situation and update this review if there are any changes.

Took 4 months to address a clearly broken gutter, and only fixed it when it literally FELL OFF the side of my house and landed in my neighbors deck. During this time I received no communciation from Cedar regarding the process, the property manager didn't have a direct phone line (?????) and when she deemed it necessary to communicate was profoundly unprofessional.

I understand that the HOA is ultimately responsible for approving maintenance of the buildings, but Cedar leaves a LOT to be desired from a property management standpoint. I will strongly suggest my HOA choose a different company.
owner_answer: Brendan - Our goal is to always respond quickly and to provide detailed information on repair request and status.  Feel free to contact our office if we can assist further.  Our email is support@mycmg.com.

review_text:
Cedar Management has worked with my Homeowners Association for the last 6-7 years.  Everytime I have emailed their office or spoken with someone on the phone about a concern or problem in my neighborhood, I have gotten the impression that I am speaking with a twelve year old.
I believe the sole responsibility of the receptionist is to answer the phone and do anything but pass that caller along to someone who can really answer their questions.  Appears her job is to "tell the customer whatever they need to hear to get them off the phone".   In a matter of 15 minutes I was given 5 different reasons for the current issues going on around my home.  The girl answering the phone, had no clue what she was talking about, and couldnt begin to understand my question.
Their customer service and our community/neighborhood manager are some of the most unprofessional people I have ever had experience dealing with.  My community manager sent out an important email at 5:10 PM on a Thursday evening that said "Work will begin on your property on the following Monday, contact us with any questions".  I immediately respond to her email with a question and I get her out of office, that she won't be in the following day (Friday) and their offices are closed on Monday.  Seriously!  What a joke!
I wouldn't recommend this company to my worst enemy.
owner_answer:
Angelica - While we appreciate your feedback, there are some issues with the information you have shared.  First, Our offices are always open Monday to Thursday from 8A - 6:30P and on Fridays from 8A - 2P.  The only days our offices would be closed are holidays.

Our Community Support Team and Manager are experienced and are here to assist.  We would never try to "push" someone off a call to our office for any reason.  Our goal is to give complete and real information that is helpful to all who contact us.

We have  looked into the calls in our communication logs regarding your account and do have some issues with what has been shared.  We would appreciate the opportunity to review the files with you and clear up any confusion as our records show a different story than what has been shared.

Feel free to contact our office directly and we can discuss this one to one.

review_text: they have no customer service I keep getting past due notices and the fees have been paid at closing but the fools at cedar can not connect the dots and make this right. I also just tried to call and they only work till 2 on Fridays must be nice collect the money and then get lost.
owner_answer:
Mr. Snyder -
We will work to address your concerns.  Please email our support staff at support@mycmg.com.  We can call you at a time that is best for you.  Our offices do close at 2P on Friday but we are open Monday - Thursday from 8:30A - 6:30P to ensure that homeowners can contact us over a more broad part of the day.  Please also keep in mind we don't collect money for our company but for our trusted communities.  Thank you.

review_text: Since transferring our HOA from self managed to having a management company (Cedar) we have been amazed at the amount of work and effort they have put into our community. Our neighborhood has really changed for the better and we couldn't be happier with the decision we made.
Under new management and the place is completely different and so much better!
owner_answer: Thank you for sharing.

review_text: I have nothing but good things about Cedar since living in our HOA. They have been our management company for roughly 4 years now and the community has been kept immaculate. If you want a company that truly cares, go with Cedar.
owner_answer: Thank you Chris.  We will share with our team.

review_text: Was able to get in touch with my property manager very quickly to handle the clubhouse reservations. My past management company you could never get a hold of anyone!
Thank you, Kala O’Connor! Friendly and professional!
owner_answer: We appreciate the 5-star review, Chip! Sending Kala your generous words as well!

review_text: We highly recommend Cedar! Their staff is so helpful and every need we've had has always been addressed promptly.

I have always received friendly service from CMG. Serving on my HOA board I keep in contact with Josh, our community manager. Cedar helps us with the pool every spring and they do a great job at helping us with vendors and at annual meetings.
owner_answer: Megan, Thank you for the kind words.  Our staff of almost 50 work very hard each day to provide quality service.  We appreciate your feedback.

review_text: Cedar Management Group is a HORRIBLE company to deal with.   They send bogus violations letters and you can never get a straight answer from them.  Just alot of FINES and the run around.  Giving the a 1 star is being considerate to say the least.  They suck!!
They are ok to deal with generally, but like most property managers hardly a delight.
Great company. Friendly service. Clean office.
owner_answer: Thank you for your feedback.

review_text: I dropped off a payment in their mailbox a month ago and no one seems to be able to know where the payment is....The most frustrating thing is I have been calling for three weeks attempting to speak to the accounting department to find out about the check...Everytime I called I was told it would take 48 hours to get a call back...Would never get a call back..Then I would call again the same thing....I finally got a call from the accounting department a month later because I emailed the VP/secretary.....But the check is just hanging around in Lala land and no one have a clue what happened....I better not be charged a late fee..Smh awful service....
owner_answer: Shanna - We are checking our records and it appears we have returned every logged call from you to provide updates regarding your payment.  Feel free to email us at help@mycmg.com and we can call you again to discuss and review potential next steps.

review_text: I don't how my HOA hired this management group.  I have been trying to get something fixed for three months - and it's serious structural damage.  When they finally said it will be fixed they would not give me any information about who it is or when it will be done so that I can make arrangements for someone to be here.  They do not return telephone calls.  We are paying less than our previous management company.  You get what you pay for.
owner_answer:
Ms. Newman -
Based on the records regarding your account we don't see the issues you are posting here.  Please feel free to contact our support team via email at support@mycmg.com or by calling 704-644-8808.  We have flagged your account and will do all we can to assist you.  Thank you.

review_text: Their main business seems to be finding ways to agner residents, cause strife with HOA boards and milk both residents and boards for more money.  Their record keeping is deplorable, their money management horrid and their ability to correctly identify what owner and or property has issues makes me wonder if they have a blind person doing inspections.  Avoid like the Plague.

Wanted to leave a write up for Cedar because they manage our HOA in Ballantyne and I think they do a good job. Back in the Spring we had to switch landscaping companies a couple of times to find one who met our expectations. It took some time but Cedar helped us with that process of finding the right company and now our community looks amazing. We've never had any communications issues and we will continue to use them.
owner_answer: Thomas we appreciate the feedback and kind words.  We work hard to provide good services to all our clients.

review_text: They are horrible.  My neighbor leaves his trash can out for several days after pickup. I put mine away within a couple of hours after pickup.  However, I'm the one that gets the the threatening notices.  How incompetent do you have to be to not be able to get the address correct of the violator?  I have even told them time after time that they have the wrong address.  Basically, I'm paying these dolts HOA dues to harass me week after week.  That's just awesome.
owner_answer: Victoria- we have looked into this situation and the letters are not being sent to your address.  We would ask you contact our office so the we can further investigate the issue and provide resolution.  Thank you.

review_text: I called this company multiple times regarding the issue that my home is NOT in the HOA. This company took over from Prestige Management who knew about this issue as well. This company is trying to collect HOA fees from residents in our subdivision who are NOT in the HOA! This company has been notified that there are 19 homes in the subdivision that are NOT in the HOA! I am not the only one that this company is fraudulently trying to collect dues from people who don't owe them! This place knows what they are doing and still harass homeowners in the subdivision that don't belong to the HOA! This company is NOT to be trusted! Stay far away!
owner_answer: John - Please email your concern to help@mycmg.com.  We will do all we can to assist you.

review_text: I have had a bad experience with this company. I'm not a guy who writes reviews, but this has rubbed me the wrong way. They took over the management fee for our company and I was never, ever contacted. They had the wrong address, didn't take blame. Sent the right information to the wrong address (meaning on the envelope was the wrong address, the paper inside contained my actual address) for a while. Finally it was forwarded to me and i got in touch with them. They hadn't auto drafted from my account for 6 months and i had a huge bill. Then I re-entered for auto draft and STILL they didn't auto draft. I've never had to try to hard to give someone money.
Erin has the bet customer service
owner_answer: Thank you for your 5-star review! It is truly our pleasure to serve your community.

review_text: Our association has been with them for almost 5 years. They are very responsive and a great company.
One star....enough said
owner_answer: We hate to see your negative review, Aiken. Please email us at help@mycmg.com so that we may have an opportunity to address your questions or concerns about your community! Please be sure to include the name of your association and property address so that we can assist you.

review_text: They truly are a professional management firm and exceed expectations.
owner_answer: Thank you Jason.  We appreciate your feedback.

review_text:
I send in a request online, nothing happens.  I call about it, wait on hold for 15 minutes, and it turns out they never got the request from their website.  3 weeks later.... call them again, still have no update on my request.  They don't know the status because it is with "maintenance", whom I cannot speak to unless my request is over a month old... Really?

STAY AWAY from this management company.  I have never had to deal with such poor customer service regarding my HOA or maintenance requests.
owner_answer: \We have record of your online request and also shared that request along with your phone call to our office today with your Board of Directors.  Please keep in mind these request must be approved by the Board and this can take some time to receive approval.  Your request has been forwarded to the Board for review and approval.  We will provide you with an update as soon as we are able to receive final confirmation on status.

review_text:
We own a home at Heritage Green subdivision, a very beautiful  place for a family to grow .  Close to everything and very well maintained.. my problem is with Cedar Management company.   Their  job is to enforce the rules....and to keep our property values  secure.   For many months there has been a large boat  on a trailer, shrinkwrapped, and stored on the street at Glenashley.  If any of the other homeowners at Heritage Green had boats
I'm sure they too would save a lot of money if they could store their boat
in front of their homes at Heritage Green.  How would that look and what would happen to our property values.
While these people may be receiving fines for this, my question is how long is a situation like this permitted to go on if the people ignore the fines, or pay them, and refuse to rectify the situation.
It seems that all of the homeowners in Heritage Green who obey the rules deserve to have a situation like this dealt with in a timely manner.

We have had a home in a development managed by Keuster Management, and something like this would never have happened there.
Great place to hang out with my favorite people!
owner_answer: Thanks Bubba!

review_text: I want to thank Gregory for the help!!!
owner_answer: We want to thank you for the 5-star review, Brandon. Thank you! We'll definitely forward on your gratitude to Gregory as well!

review_text: Cedar Management has been extremely helpful to the Board of Directors throughout the whole transition process. Less fees and even less headaches has made switching to Cedar last month such a relief.
Cedar Mgmt recently became responsible for  managing my unit and to date I am not satisfied with their accounting abilities.  Totally disappointed.
owner_answer:
Ms. Campbell -
It appears you have posted your complaint to the wrong company.  We don't manage rental property or individual units.  Our business is to only manage HOA and Condominium units.  You may wish to check your records and contact the rental management company working with your property.  Thank you.

review_text: I live in a property managed by Cedar Management. They are extremely unorganized and misappropriate HOA fees. They charge fees that they can no account for and they provide their residents with misleading information.

BEWARE!!!! This company will not recognize you as a resident if you are a renter through the property management company,  Progress Residential. So if you have been fined for whatever reason be preparers to pay thousands of dollars because you will not get notices of warning since the only communication the HOA has is with the property management company who I believe ups the fines because they know the HOA won't discuss anything with you.
owner_answer: Natasha - If you are renting a home in a community we ask that you work via your rental company and or homeowner to address concerns.  We will do all we can to assist and be helpful.  We are required to work with the homeowner and or authorized represenative in regards to addressing violations and pending fines.  If you have additional concerns please have the homeowner and or rental management company contact us at help@mycmg.com.  Thank you.

review_text: Great staff! Knows how to handle their market and takes care of their clients!
Great Company!  Fantastic Customer Service.
They are terrible. People park on the street and nothing done. They are nothing but crooks collecting dues for NOTHING.
owner_answer: Keith - Sorry to hear you are having an issue with parking in your community.  We encourage you to let our office know when there are issues with parking so we can notify the Board of Directors in your community and determine if a violation letter should be sent.  We also encourage you to contact local authorities to report this as parking on public streets can also be a offense that could result in ticketing and possible towing.  We are always here to assist and help all residents with issues that come up from day to day in communities where we provide management.

review_text: This has to be the biggest group of idiots I have ever dealt with in my life. For the past 6 years this company has been incapable of mailing me my HOA dues. I have to find out from neighbor's that they received one or I get the late fee notice. So on top of my dues I have to pay a late fee because of there incompetence. This year marks the 7th year they failed to send me both my dues and late payment letter so they have there attorney send me a letter saying I have 15 days to pay. After seven years of this you would think someone there would try and figure out the problem or even not hit me with late fees because of there own incompetence. The management sucks and are complete idiots to allow this to go on for so many years. Failures!!!
owner_answer: Feel free to contact our office at help@mycmg.com and we will do all can to assist you.

review_text: they are slow to respond to messages.  there standard response is "please allow 30 days for a response". this is ridiculous when all I was requesting was a list a names of board members and contact info.
owner_answer:
Debra- We appreciate your concern. Please note that we take our response times very seriously and want to respond as soon as possible.

We keep all board member contact information on file for every community. However, we cannot give out anyone's private contact information without express permission from the individual, even the board. We will have to contact your board and obtain their permission before giving out their private information.

review_text: I have contacted the office in reference to my account, I was told they couldn’t help me I had to contact the payment plan department, I emailed them three times no response, no phone call I’m just trying to get my account under control before they try and forclose on my house they are not reaching out to me at all, bad business.
owner_answer:
Joanna-

We are sorry to hear about your review. We had one of our IT staff investigate this issue since nobody in our Payment Plan department received those messages. Unfortunately your original emails were marked as Spam. Google does not notify us when this occurs and we are confused as to why this was happening with our Payment Plan department but not our Community Support Department, which received your emails and responded to them. Below is a link to a screenshot where you can see the pending messages that were being held. We have whitelisted your email address in our Google Gmail account so this does not happen again.

review_text: If Satan was going to run a property management company.... it would be less anathematic and vindictive then Cedar Mngt Group.  If you're debating purchasing a property and they have Cedar as an HOA - don't buy it!  You will regret that decision for as long as you live in / own that property.  Their sole concern is getting your monthly dues and nothing more.  When I first bought my place the neighborhood association was operated by a different company.  Everything was rainbows and fairydust and neverland ranch for the first year.  Then Cedar became the new mngt company.  Dues have increased every year; they had their lawyers find loopholes to force homeowners to pay for fixing our roofs during the hail damage (by-laws blatantly state shingles are HOA's responsibility); they create new surreptitious by-laws on a whim; amenities and general landscape aesthetics have fallen off drastically or remain broken for years; and overall they've perniciously created an atmosphere of despondency.  The reps responsible for answering the phone, and therefore helping you, are the most worthless dysentery-humanoids that eugenics failed to prevent. Enjoy!
Total garbage company. Does nothing they say they will. Neighborhoods look like trash, signs and common areas in disrepair, but they sure do bill you on time! Waste of money.
KC Joy was amazing!????????

review_text: I was in the home buying process with one of the properties they manage and they neglected to inform my lender and attorney that there was an extra $250 fee they both needed to pay in order to close on the house.
